zh: 实际上，这些猿猴不知为何，突然被吓得四处逃窜。有两三只猴子连跑带爬地从一个窗户到了另一个窗户，行动敏捷得像杂技演员。它们也没有想办法把梯子拉回来，这样是很容易下来的，或许是太害怕了，它们都忘了这种逃跑的方法。开拓者们现在毫不费力就瞄准它们，开了枪。有几只猴子死了，有的受伤了就跑回了屋子里，发出尖叫的叫声。剩下那些往外跑的猴子摔在地上粉身碎骨了，不到几分钟，目前他们知道花岗石宫没有活着的猴子了。
en: In fact, the apes, seized with a sudden panic, from some unknown cause, were trying to escape.Two or three ran and clambered from one window to another with the agility of acrobats.They were not even trying to replace the ladder, by which it would have been easy to descend; perhaps in their terror they had forgotten this way of escape.The colonists, now being able to take aim without difficulty, fired.Some, wounded or killed, fell back into the rooms, uttering piercing cries.The rest, throwing themselves out, were dashed to pieces in their fall, and in a few minutes, so far as they knew, there was not a living quadrumana in Granite House.

zh: 这时，他们看见梯子从门口滑落下来，展开并摔在了地上。
en: At this moment the ladder was seen to slip over the threshold, then unroll and fall to the ground.

zh: “哈哈！”水手喊道，“这就奇怪了！”
en: “Hullo!” cried the sailor, “this is queer!”

zh: “非常奇怪！”工程师低语道，这时他已经率先爬到了梯子上。
en: “Very strange!” murmured the engineer, leaping first up the ladder.

zh: “小心点，上尉！”潘克洛夫喊道，“说不定那里还有些恶棍。”
en: “Take care, captain!” cried Pencroft, “perhaps there are still some of these rascals.

zh: “我们马上就能看到了。”工程师回答说，不过他并没有停下来。
en: “We shall soon see,” replied the engineer, without stopping however.

zh: 同伴们都跟着他，一分钟后他们就到了门口。他们到处搜寻。房间里一只猴子也没有，仓库也是，这一帮猴子曾经非常青睐这里。
en: All his companions followed him, and in a minute they had arrived at the threshold.They searched everywhere.There was no one in the rooms nor in the storehouse, which had been respected by the band of quadrumana.

zh: “现在，这梯子，”水手喊道，“哪位绅士帮我们把梯子弄下来？”
en: “Well now, and the ladder,” cried the sailor; “who can the gentleman have been who sent us that down?”

zh: 这时，他们听见了一声大叫，一只藏在通道里的大猩猩冲到屋子里来了，纳布在后面追着它。
en: But at that moment a cry was heard, and a great orang, who had hidden himself in the passage, rushed into the room, pursued by Neb.

zh: “啊，强盗！”潘克洛夫喊道。
en: “Ah, the robber!” cried Pencroft.

zh: 他手上拿着斧子，准备把那只畜生的脑袋砍下来，这时，赛勒斯·哈丁抓住了他的手，说道：
en: And hatchet in hand, he was about to cleave the head of the animal, when Cyrus Harding seized his arm, saying,—

zh: “放了它吧，潘克洛夫。”
en: “Spare him, Pencroft.”

zh: “放了这个无赖？”
en: “Pardon this rascal?”

zh: “对，是它把梯子扔给我们的！”
en: “Yes! it was he who threw us the ladder!”

zh: 工程师说这话时语气很奇怪，大家很难知道他是否是认真说的。
en: And the engineer said this in such a peculiar voice that it was difficult to know whether he spoke seriously or not.

zh: 不过，他们还是扑到了大猩猩身上，它奋力反抗，但很快就没有力气，最后被绑住了。
en: Nevertheless, they threw themselves on the orang, who defended himself gallantly, but was soon overpowered and bound.

zh: “好了！”潘克洛夫说，“现在我们已经抓住它了，该拿它怎么办？”
en: “There!” said Pencroft.“And what shall we make of him, now we’ve got him?”

zh: “当仆人！”赫伯特回答说。
en: “A servant!” replied Herbert.

zh: 这个孩子说这话可不带半点开玩笑，因为他知道可以利用这个聪明的族类。
en: The lad was not joking in saying this, for he knew how this intelligent race could be turned to account.

zh: 居民们走近这只猿猴，仔细地打量着它。它属于类人猿，这种猿猴的颜面角并不比澳大利亚人和霍屯督人次很多。它是一只猩猩，既不像大猩猩那样凶猛，又没有狒狒那样迟钝。有许多特征可以证明，这种类人猿几乎具备了和人类一样的智慧。要是雇用到家里，它们会在桌旁伺候着、打扫房间、刷鞋，还能正确使用刀叉和汤勺，甚至会喝酒，和靠两条腿走路的、最好的仆人相比，它们能把每件事都做得和他们一样好。布丰就有一只这样的猿猴，它忠诚、热心地伺候了主人很长一段时间。
en: The settlers then approached the ape and gazed at it attentively.He belonged to the family of anthropoid apes, of which the facial angle is not much inferior to that of the Australians and Hottentots.It was an orangoutang, and as such, had neither the ferocity of the gorilla, nor the stupidity of the baboon.It is to this family of the anthropoid apes that so many characteristics belong which prove them to be possessed of an almost human intelligence.Employed in houses, they can wait at table, sweep rooms, brush clothes, clean boots, handle a knife, fork, and spoon properly, and even drink wine...doing everything as well as the best servant that ever walked upon two legs.Buffon possessed one of these apes, who served him for a long time as a faithful and zealous servant.

zh: 他们在花岗石宫抓住的这只猿猴是个体型庞大的家伙，身高六英尺，身材匀称得让人羡慕，胸脯宽阔，脑袋大小合适，颜面角达65度，头颅浑圆，鼻子突出，全身长满一层柔软而光滑的毛，总之，它是类人猿中的上等品种。它的眼睛虽然比人类的要小，但闪耀着智慧的光辉。它那雪白的牙齿在胡髭下闪闪发光，下巴上还长了点卷卷的棕色小胡须。
en: The one which had been seized in the hall of Granite House was a great fellow, six feet high, with an admirably poportioned frame, a broad chest, head of a moderate size, the facial angle reaching sixty-five degrees, round skull, projecting nose, skin covered with soft glossy hair, in short, a fine specimen of the anthropoids.His eyes, rather smaller than human eyes, sparkled with intelligence; his white teeth glittered under his mustache, and he wore a little curly brown beard.

zh: “好标致的家伙！”潘克洛夫说道，“要是我们能听懂它的语言，就能和它交流了。”
en: “A handsome fellow!” said Pencroft; “if we only knew his language, we could talk to him.”

zh: “可是，主人，”纳布说，“你是认真的吗？我们真的要收它作仆人吗？”
en: “But, master,” said Neb, “are you serious?Are we going to take him as a servant?”

zh: “是啊，纳布，”工程师笑着回答说，“但你可不许嫉妒哦。”
en: “Yes, Neb,” replied the engineer, smiling.“But you must not be jealous.”

zh: “我希望它能当一个出色的仆人，”赫伯特又说道，“它看上去很年轻，肯定很容易训练，而且，我们不能用武力使它服从，也不能像别人一样拔掉它的牙齿。如果主人对它好，它很快就会喜欢上主人的。”
en: “And I hope he will make an excellent servant,” added Herbert.“He appears young, and will be easy to educate, and we shall not be obliged to use force to subdue him, nor draw his teeth, as is sometimes done.He will soon grow fond of his masters if they are kind to him.”

zh: “他们会的。”潘克洛夫回答说，这时他已经忘记了对“开玩笑者”的仇恨。
en: “And they will be,” replied Pencroft, who had forgotten all his rancor against “the jokers.”

zh: 然后，他靠近这只猩猩，说道：
en: Then, approaching the orang,—

zh: “嘿，老家伙！”他问道，“你好吗？”
en: “Well, old boy!” he asked, “how are you?”

zh: 猩猩发出了点哼哼的声音，不过没有显出生气之意。
en: The orang replied by a little grunt which did not show any anger.

zh: “你愿意加入我们这些开拓者吗？”水手问道，“你当赛勒斯·哈丁上尉的仆人怎么样？”
en: “You wish to join the colony?” again asked the sailor.“You are going to enter the service of Captain Cyrus Harding?”

zh: 猩猩又发出了哼哼声回应。
en: Another respondent grunt was uttered by the ape.

zh: “你的回报只有食物没有薪水，你满意吧？”
en: “And you will be satisfied with no other wages than your food?”

zh: 它第三次发出哼哼声。
en: Third affirmative grunt.

zh: “这个谈话似乎有点无趣啊！”吉丁·史佩莱说。
en: “This conversation is slightly monotonous,” observed Gideon Spilett.

zh: “这样最好，”潘克洛夫回答说，“最好的仆人就是说话最少的。没有工资，听见了吗，伙计？刚开始我们不会给你任何报酬，不过要是以后我们对你满意，就会让你的报酬加倍。”
en: “So much the better,” replied Pencroft; “the best servants are those who talk the least.And then, no wages, do you hear, my boy?We will give you no wages at first, but we will double them afterwards if we are pleased with you.”

zh: 这样，开拓地又增添了一位新成员。至于它的名字，为了纪念他曾经认识的一只猿猴，他请求给它取名叫丘辟特，简称贾普。
en: Thus the colony was increased by a new member.As to his name the sailor begged that in memory of another ape which he had known, he might be called Jupiter, and Jup for short.

zh: 这样，在没有任何仪式的情况下，主人贾普在花岗石宫住下了。
en: And so, without more ceremony, Master Jup was installed in Granite House.

zh: 第七章
en: Chapter 7

zh: 这些林肯岛上的居民重新夺回了他们的住所，而且他们也不用从原来的入口进去，所以也就省去了泥匠的工作。他们确实很幸运，正当他们要推翻石头墙的时候，猿猴被某种恐惧吓得逃出了花岗石宫，这既突然又不可理解。难道这群动物发现了自己会受到来自另一个方向的攻击吗？这就是它们突然逃离的唯一解释。
en: The settlers in Lincoln Island had now regained their dwelling, without having been obliged to reach it by the old opening, and were therefore spared the trouble of mason’s work.It was certainly lucky, that at the moment they were about to set out to do so, the apes had been seized with that terror, no less sudden than inexplicable, which had driven them out of Granite House.Had the animals discovered that they were about to be attacked from another direction?This was the only explanation of their sudden retreat.

zh: 白天的时候，他们把死猿猴的尸体搬到树林里埋了，接着他们就开始收拾这些入侵者造成的混乱，但没有什么破坏，虽然这些猴子把屋子弄得乱七八糟，但它们没有破坏什么东西。纳布重新点燃了炉子，食品室里的储备还能做一顿大餐，大家都饱饱地吃了一顿。
en: During the day the bodies of the apes were carried into the wood, where they were buried; then the settlers busied themselves in repairing the disorder caused by the intruders, disorder but not damage, for although they had turned everything in the rooms topsy-turvy, yet they had broken nothing.Neb relighted his stove, and the stores in the larder furnished a substantial repast, to which all did ample justice.

zh: 大家没忘了贾普，他们给它提供了很多南欧松子和根茎，贾普津津有味地吃起来了。潘克洛夫把他的前肢松开了，不过他觉得在更确信贾普服从之前，最好把它的后肢绑住。
en: Jup was not forgotten, and he ate with relish some stonepine almonds and rhizome roots, with which he was abundantly supplied.Pencroft had unfastened his arms, but judged it best to have his legs tied until they were more sure of his submission.

zh: 在回去休息之前，哈丁和他的同伴们围坐在桌子旁边，讨论那些计划，执行这些计划十分紧迫。现在最重要而且最紧迫的事就是在慈悲河上架一座桥，以建立岛屿南部和花岗石宫的交通，再就是建一个围栏，圈养他们打算捕获的摩弗伦羊和其他多毛的羊。
en: Then, before retiring to rest, Harding and his companions seated round their table, discussed those plans, the execution of which was most pressing.The most important and most urgent was the establishment of a bridge over the Mercy, so as to form a communication with the southern part of the island and Granite House; then the making of an enclosure for the musmons or other woolly animals which they wished to capture.

zh: 这两个工程可以解决他们的衣服问题，这是目前非常重要的事情。桥梁能使他们轻松运回气球套，那样他们就能够得到亚麻布，而围栏里的牲畜可以产羊毛，他们就有冬衣穿了。
en: These two projects would help to solve the difficulty as to their clothing, which was now serious.The bridge would render easy the transport of the balloon case, which would furnish them with linen, and the inhabitants of the enclosure would yield wool which would supply them with winter clothes.

zh: 赛勒斯·哈丁提议把围栏设在红河的发源地，在那里，反刍动物可以吃到新鲜而充足的牧草。从眺望岗到红河源头的路有一部分已经开辟了，而且，要是他们能有到比先前那辆更好的车，尤其是他们若能抓到拉车的动物，材料就能很容易地运到这里。
en: As to the enclosure, it was Cyrus Harding’s intention to establish it at the sources of the Red Creek, where the ruminants would find fresh and abundant pasture.The road between Prospect Heights and the sources of the stream was already partly beaten, and with a better cart than the first, the material could be easily conveyed to the spot, especially if they could manage to capture some animals to draw it.

zh: 围栏离花岗石宫很远，虽然可能并没有什么不便，可家禽场就不一样了，纳布提醒拓荒者们注意这一点。确实，鸟类应该在厨师触手可及的地方，要建所谓的家禽场，再也没有比靠近原来入口的河岸更合适的地方了。
en: But though there might be no inconvenience in the enclosure being so far from Granite House, it would not be the same with the poultry-yard, to which Neb called the attention of the colonists.It was indeed necessary that the birds should be close within reach of the cook, and no place appeared more favorable for the establishment of the said poultry-yard than that portion of the banks of the lake which was close to the old opening.

zh: 水鸟以及其他的鸟类都可以在那里繁育，他们上次捕猎途中捉到的一对鹌鹑是第一批被驯养的。
en: Water-birds would prosper there as well as others, and the couple of tinamous taken in their last excursion would be the first to be domesticated.

zh: 第二天是11月3号，他们开始了新工作——建桥，这项重大工程需要每个人都参与。居民们肩上扛着锯子、斧头和锤子，现在又变成了木匠，下行到海岸边。
en: The next day, the 3rd of November, the new works were begun by the construction of the bridge, and all hands were required for this important task.Saws, hatchets, and hammers were shouldered by the settlers, who, now transformed into carpenters, descended to the shore.

zh: 这时，潘克洛夫说道：
en: There Pencroft observed,—

zh: “昨天贾普礼貌地把梯子还给了我们，可要是我们不在的时候，它动歪脑筋把梯子拿走了怎么办？”
en: “Suppose, that during our absence, Master Jup takes it into his head to draw up the ladder which he so politely returned to us yesterday?”

zh: “那我们就把梯子的下端往下拉点，并固定住。”赛勒斯·哈丁回答说。
en: “Let us tie its lower end down firmly,” replied Cyrus Harding.

zh: 他们把两根桩子固定在了沙子里，这样就把梯子绑住了。接着，居民就上了慈悲河的左岸，很快他们就到了河流的拐角处。
en: This was done by means of two stakes securely fixed in the sand.Then the settlers, ascending the left bank of the Mercy, soon arrived at the angle formed by the river.

zh: 他们在那里停下来，想确定是否能从这里把桥搭到对面去。这个地点看起来很合适。
en: There they halted, in order to ascertain if the bridge could be thrown across.The place appeared suitable.

zh: 事实上，他们这里离前天在南岸发现的气球港只有3.5英尺，而且，在桥和气球港之间修一条大车能通行的道路也很容易，这样，花岗石宫和岛屿南部的交通就能变得很便捷了。
en: In fact, from this spot, to Port Balloon, discovered the day before on the southern coast, there was only a distance of three miles and a half, and from the bridge to the Port, it would be easy to make a good cart-road which would render the communication between Granite House and the south of the island extremely easy.

zh: 赛勒斯·哈丁给大伙说了个方案，就是说把眺望岗完全孤立起来，这样它也就能远离四足兽和灵长类动物的进攻。如此一来，花岗石宫、石窟、家禽场以及用来耕种的整个高地上部都能免受动物的掠夺。再也没有比执行这个工程更简单的了，这也是工程师打算做的事情。
en: Cyrus Harding now imparted to his companions a scheme for completely isolating Prospect Heights so as to shelter it from the attacks both of quadrupeds and quadrumana.In this way, Granite House, the Chimneys, the poultry-yard, and all the upper part of the plateau which was to be used for cultivation, would be protected against the depredations of animals.Nothing could be easier than to execute this project, and this is how the engineer intended to set to work.

zh: 高地三面已经被水道防卫起来，有的是人工挖的，有的是天然产生的。在西北部的格兰特湖岸，从通道的入口处延伸至湖岸的裂口，是为了河水泻出的。
en: The plateau was already defended on three sides by water-courses, either artificial or natural.On the northwest, by the shores of Lake Grant, from the entrance of the passage to the breach made in the banks of the lake for the escape of the water.

zh: 北部的出水口至海边形成了一条新的水道，这条水道经过高地和海岸，然后在瀑布的上下两端冲刷出了河床，只要把河床挖深，就足以使动物无法进入。而在全部的东部边界上，从上面提过的河流河口到慈悲河口旁都是海洋。
en: On the north, from this breach to the sea, by the new water-course which had hollowed out a bed for itself across the plateau and shore, above and below the fall, and it would be enough to dig the bed of this creek a little deeper to make it impracticable for animals, on all the eastern border by the sea itself, from the mouth of the aforesaid creek to the mouth of the Mercy.

zh: 最后在南边，从河口到慈悲河的拐角处就是将要架桥的地方。
en: Lastly, on the south, from the mouth to the turn of the Mercy where the bridge was to be established.

zh: 高地的西部边界现在仍在河流拐角和湖的南角，这段距离长约一英里，是完全开放的地方。可是，再也没有比挖一条又宽又深的水渠更简单的事了，水渠可以从河流引水，水满了就可以形成湍急的瀑布，落入慈悲河的河床。毫无疑问，湖水水位会因为新排出的水而降低一些，不过，赛勒斯·哈丁确信，红河巨大的水量足够保证执行这项工程。
en: The western border of the plateau now remained between the turn of the river and the southern angle of the lake, a distance of about a mile, which was open to all comers.But nothing could be easier than to dig a broad deep ditch, which could be filled from the lake, and the overflow of which would throw itself by a rapid fall into the bed of the Mercy.The level of the lake would, no doubt, be somewhat lowered by this fresh discharge of its waters, but Cyrus Harding had ascertained that the volume of water in the Red Creek was considerable enough to allow of the execution of this project.

zh: “这样的话，”工程师补充道，“眺望岗就会成为四面环水的普通小岛，从眺望岗去岛上的其他地方，就只能经过我们要架在慈悲河上的新桥，还有瀑布上下两端的旧桥。最后，我们还要造两座小桥，一座架在我建议开挖的运河上，另一座通往慈悲河的左岸。如果这些桥都能如愿架好的，眺望岗就不会受到任何突袭了。”
en: “So then,” added the engineer, “Prospect Heights will become a regular island, being surrounded with water on all sides, and only communicating with the rest of our domain by the bridge which we are about to throw across the Mercy, the two little bridges already established above and below the fall; and, lastly, two other little bridges which must be constructed, one over the canal which I propose to dig, the other across to the left bank of the Mercy.Now, if these bridges can be raised at will, Prospect Heights will be guarded from any surprise.”

zh: 架桥成为最紧迫的事务了。他们选好树砍了下来，把树枝去掉，然后就把树干裁成了桥梁、托架和厚板。慈悲河右岸的桥端必须牢固，不过左岸的桥端可以是活动的，这样桥梁就可以像有些运河桥一样通过均衡锤提起来。
en: The bridge was the most urgent work.Trees were selected, cut down, stripped of their branches, and cut into beams, joists, and planks.The end of the bridge which rested on the right bank of the Mercy was to be firm, but the other end on the left bank was to be movable, so that it might be raised by means of a counterpoise, as some canal bridges are managed.

zh: 这工作无疑是相当艰巨的，虽然得到很有技巧的指导，但这工作要费点时间，因为慈悲河在这里的宽度达80英尺。因此，他们有必要在河床上打好桥桩，以支撑桥板，他们还得安一个打桩机在桥桩顶上。另外，桥桩需要形成拱门，使桥梁承受很大的重量。
en: This was certainly a considerable work, and though it was skillfully conducted, it took some time, for the Mercy at this place was eighty feet wide.It was therefore necessary to fix piles in the bed of the river so as to sustain the floor of the bridge and establish a pile-driver to act on the tops of these piles, which would thus form two arches and allow the bridge to support heavy loads.

zh: 幸运的是，他们不缺少木材用具，也不缺少用来固定木头的铁制工具，更不缺少聪明智慧、造桥知识非凡的人，最后他们也不缺热情高昂的同伴，在过去的七个月里，他们已经学会了使用这些工具的精湛技巧。还有必须要提到的是技术熟练的吉丁·史佩莱，他灵巧的手艺和水手几乎不分伯仲。“谁会想到一个记者会干这么多事！”潘克洛夫想。
en: Happily there was no want of tools with which to shape the wood, nor of iron-work to make it firm, nor of the ingenuity of a man who had a marvelous knowledge of the work, nor lastly, the zeal of his companions, who in seven months had necessarily acquired great skill in the use of their tools; and it must be said that not the least skilful was Gideon Spilett, who in dexterity almost equaled the sailor himself.“Who would ever have expected so much from a newspaper man!” thought Pencroft.

zh: 慈悲桥的建造持续了三个星期，他们每天辛辛苦苦地工作。他们甚至连早饭都是在干活的工地吃的，由于天气很好，他们只有睡觉的时候才回到花岗石宫。
en: The construction of the Mercy bridge lasted three weeks of regular hard work.They even breakfasted on the scene of their labors, and the weather being magnificent, they only returned to Granite House to sleep.

zh: 在这段时间，可以说贾普越来越习惯他的新主人了，他总是用好奇的眼神看着他们的举动。但是，作为预防措施，潘克洛夫还是没有给它完全的自由，他想等到高地的定界工程完成以后再说，这种考虑是很恰当的。托普和贾普喜欢在一起玩耍，他们成了好朋友，但是贾普做每件事都很严肃。
en: During this period it may be stated that Master Jup grew more accustomed to his new masters, whose movements he always watched with very inquisitive eyes.However, as a precautionary measure, Pencroft did not as yet allow him complete liberty, rightly wishing to wait until the limits of the plateau should be settled by the projected works.Top and Jup were good friends and played willingly together, but Jup did everything solemnly.

zh: 11月20号，桥梁终于竣工了。通过均衡锤的作用，桥梁的活动部分很容易就能挂起来，而且只需一点儿力气就能把它吊起来。用以支撑桥梁下降的最后一根横木以及桥梁的枢纽之间，存在20英尺宽的缝隙，它足以阻挡任何动物爬上来。
en: On the 20th of November the bridge was finished.The movable part, balanced by the counterpoise, swung easily, and only a slight effort was needed to rise it; between its hinge and the last cross-bar on which it rested when closed, there existed a space of twenty feet, which was sufficiently wide to prevent any animals from crossing.

zh: 这些岛上的居民开始考虑把气球取回来，他们都特别想把气球放到万分安全的地方。不过要拿回来，他们必须先弄辆推车到气球港，于是他们还得在远西森林茂密的树丛中开辟出一条道路。要完成这些任务需要花一定的时间。另外，纳布和潘克洛夫在气球港查看完情况后说，放在洞穴里的布不会受到损坏，于是大家决定继续进行眺望岗的工程。
en: The settlers now began to talk of fetching the balloon-case, which they were anxious to place in perfect security; but to bring it, it would be necessary to take a cart to Port Balloon, and consequently, necessary to beat a road through the dense forests of the Far West.This would take some time.Also, Neb and Pencroft having gone to examine into the state of things at Port Balloon, and reported that the stock of cloth would suffer no damage in the grotto where it was stored, it was decided that the work at Prospect Heights should not be discontinued.

zh: “这样的话，”潘克洛夫说道，“我们就能把家禽场建得更好了，因为我们不用担心会有狐狸的造访，或是其他野兽的攻击了。”
en: “That,” observed Pencroft, “will enable us to establish our poultry-yard under better conditions, since we need have no fear of visits from foxes nor the attacks of other beasts.”

zh: “那么，”纳布补充道，“我们可以清理一下高地，然后把野生植物移植到那里。”
en: “Then,” added Neb, “we can clear the plateau, and transplant wild plants to it.”

zh: “还能准备我们的第二块麦田！”水手带着胜利者的姿态喊起来了。
en: “And prepare our second corn-field!” cried the sailor with a triumphant air.

zh: 确实，多亏了潘克洛夫的照料，只种了一颗谷粒的第一块麦地生长得极好。正如工程师预言的，这颗麦粒长出了十个穗子，每个穗子又结出了80颗麦玉米粒，六个月的时间里，他们就得到了800颗麦粒，这样他们每年都能有两次大丰收了。
en: In fact, the first corn-field sown with a single grain had prospered admirably, thanks to Pencroft’s care.It had produced the ten ears foretold by the engineer, and each ear containing eighty grains, the colony found itself in possession of eight hundred grains, in six months, which promised a double harvest each year.

zh: 这800颗麦粒除了要留出50颗细心保留外，其他的都要种到新开辟的土地上，而且，它们会像第一颗庄稼那样得到十分细致的培育。
en: These eight hundred grains, except fifty, which were prudently reserved, were to be sown in a new field, but with no less care than was bestowed on the single grain.

zh: 新的土地准备好了，接着他们就在旁边立了一圈结实的栅栏，栅栏很高，而且顶部也削尖了，这样四足动物就没那么容易跳进来了。至于如何对付那些飞鸟，潘克洛夫那机灵的大脑想出扎一些稻草人，就足以把它们吓走。剩下的750颗麦粒都整齐地种在了田垄里，剩下的就要交给大自然了。
en: The field was prepared, then surrounded with a strong palisade, high and pointed, which quadrupeds would have found difficulty in leaping.As to birds, some scarecrows, due to Pencroft’s ingenious brain, were enough to frighten them.The seven hundred and fifty grains deposited in very regular furrows were then left for nature to do the rest.

zh: 11月21号这天，赛勒斯·哈丁开始规划建设运河，运河从格兰特湖的南角延伸至慈悲河的拐角处，从而将西边的高地与其他地方隔离开来。这里的土壤有两三英尺都是腐殖土，再下面就是花岗岩。所以，他们需要再造一些硝化甘油，用来做它惯常的工作。不到两个星期，他们就在高地坚硬的地面中挖出了一条深6英尺、宽12英尺的沟渠。他们还用同样的方法在湖的岩石边缘挖出了另外一条沟渠，形成了一条小溪，他们给它取名叫甘油河，因此成为慈悲河的支流。正如工程师所预料的那样，湖水的水位下降了，虽然下降得非常少。为了完成将高地全部围住的工程，他们将海滩上的河床大大拓宽了，还用木桩固定住沙子。
en: On the 21st of November, Cyrus Harding began to plan the canal which was to close the plateau on the west, from the south angle of Lake Grant to the angle of the Mercy.There was there two or three feet of vegetable earth, and below that granite.It was therefore necessary to manufacture some more nitro-glycerine, and the nitro-glycerine did its accustomed work.In less than a fortnight a ditch, twelve feet wide and six deep, was dug out in the hard ground of the plateau.A new trench was made by the same means in the rocky border of the lake, forming a small stream, to which they gave the name of Creek Glycerine, and which was thus an affluent of the Mercy.As the engineer had predicted, the level of the lake was lowered, though very slightly.To complete the enclosure the bed of the stream on the beach was considerably enlarged, and the sand supported by means of stakes.

zh: 到12月中旬，他们就干完了这些活，眺望岗这个不规则的五边形，有长达近四英里的边界线，如今已被河流地带包围了，如此一来，不管什么样的盗贼都完全侵袭不了这里。
en: By the end of the first fortnight of December these works were finished, and Prospect Heights—that is to say, a sort of irregular pentagon, having a perimeter of nearly four miles, surrounded by a liquid belt—was completely protected from depredators of every description.

zh: 十二月的时候，天气非常炎热。即使这样，居民们仍然继续干活，由于想拥有一个家禽场，他们立马就开始动手。
en: During the month of December, the heat was very great.In spite of it, however, the settlers continued their work, and as they were anxious to possess a poultry-yard they forthwith commenced it.

zh: 自不用说，高地的围栏工程完成以后，贾普就自由了。他并没有离开他的主人，而且没有表示逃跑的意思。虽然它劲儿很大，也非常活跃，但是它是个温和的动物。大家已经教会他变成有价值的一员，它会拉木头，以及运送从甘油河河床里刨出来的石头。
en: It is useless to say that since the enclosing of the plateau had been completed, Master Jup had been set at liberty.He did not leave his masters, and evinced no wish to escape.He was a gentle animal, though very powerful and wonderfully active.He was already taught to make himself useful by drawing loads of wood and carting away the stones which were extracted from the bed of Creek Glycerine.

zh: 家禽场位于湖泊东南岸，占地200平方码。场地周围都是栅栏，里面为了繁殖鸟类，搭建了各种各样的棚子。这些棚用树枝简单搭成，而且被隔成了许多小单间，供要到来的客人居住。
en: The poultry-yard occupied an area of two hundred square yards, on the southeastern bank of the lake.It was surrounded by a palisade, and in it were constructed various shelters for the birds which were to populate it.These were simply built of branches and divided into compartments, made ready for the expected guests.

zh: 最早来这里的是两只鹌鹑，它们不久就有了许多小鹌鹑，和它们一起住的还有六只鸭子，它们更习惯呆在湖边。其中有几只是中国种类的鸭，它们的翅膀张开时像扇子，羽毛绚丽多彩，可以与金鸡相媲美。几天后，赫伯特套住了一对鹑鸡，它们尾巴向外伸展开来，上面长着长长的羽毛，这些漂亮的黑凤冠雉很快就被驯服了。　至于鹈鹕、翠鸟和大鷭，它们都是主动来到家禽场岸边的，这个小群体刚开始有些争执，不停咕咕地叫、尖叫、咯咯的叫，不过最后都在这里安静地住下来了，它们的繁殖速度喜人，保证了将来开拓地的食物。
en: The first were the two tinamous, which were not long in having a number of young ones; they had for companions half a dozen ducks, accustomed to the borders of the lake.Some belonged to the Chinese species, of which the wings open like a fan, and which by the brilliancy of their plumage rival the golden pheasants.A few days afterwards, Herbert snared a couple of gallinaceae, with spreading tails composed of long feathers, magnificent alectors, which soon became tame.As to pelicans, kingfishers, water-hens, they came of themselves to the shores of the poultry-yard, and this little community, after some disputes, cooing, screaming, clucking, ended by settling down peacefully, and increased in encouraging proportion for the future use of the colony.

zh: 赛勒斯·哈丁为了使自己的工作更完美，在家禽场的一处角落里建了一个鸽棚。他把十几只经常光顾高地的鸽子都安放在了这个鸽棚里。这些飞鸟很快就习惯了每天晚上飞回它们的新住所，而且，它们显示出比同类斑鸠更愿驯服自己的品性。
en: Cyrus Harding, wishing to complete his performance, established a pigeon-house in a corner of the poultry-yard.There he lodged a dozen of those pigeons which frequented the rocks of the plateau.These birds soon became accustomed to returning every evening to their new dwelling, and showed more disposition to domesticate themselves than their congeners, the wood-pigeons.

zh: 终于，利用气球的时刻到了，他们把它剪成片，再做成衬衫和其他东西。而要保持气球的现状，再次冒险坐上充满气体的气球，飞在海上的高度极限他们自己也不知道，所以这种想法是不予考虑的。
en: Lastly, the time had come for turning the balloon-case to use, by cutting it up to make shirts and other articles; for as to keeping it in its present form, and risking themselves in a balloon filled with gas, above a sea of the limits of which they had no idea, it was not to be thought of.

zh: 他们需要把气球运到花岗石宫，但开拓者们要想办法使车子变得更轻、更易控制。不过，就算他们有车子，拉车的动力仍在寻找中。
en: It was necessary to bring the case to Granite House, and the colonists employed themselves in rendering their heavy cart lighter and more manageable.But though they had a vehicle, the moving power was yet to be found.

zh: 难道这个岛上就没有能替代牛、马或驴子位置的牲畜吗？这的确是个问题。
en: But did there not exist in the island some animal which might supply the place of the horse, ass, or ox?That was the question.

zh: “当然，”潘克洛夫说，“畜力对我们很有用，直到上尉做了辆蒸汽卡车，甚至是发动机，早晚有一天，从花岗石宫到气球港会有铁路，还有一条支线通往富兰克林山！”
en: “Certainly,” said Pencroft, “a beast of burden would be very useful to us until the captain has made a steam cart, or even an engine, for some day we shall have a railroad from Granite House to Port Balloon, with a branch line to Mount Franklin!”

zh: 12月23号这天，纳布和托普都大喊大叫，两个家伙显然在比谁能发出最大的喊声。在石窟忙着干活的居民赶快跑过来，担心出了什么伤脑筋的事。
en: One day, the 23rd of December, Neb and Top were heard shouting and barking, each apparently trying to see who could make the most noise.The settlers, who were busy at the Chimneys, ran, fearing some vexatious incident.

zh: 猜猜他们看到什么了？原来，有两只大型的、驯良的动物从开放的桥梁上不小心闯进了高地。有人可能会说它们是马，至少是驴子，一公一母，体形健壮，身上是深灰色，四肢和尾巴是白色，而头和颈部则有黑色的条纹。它们安静地往前进，没有显示出任何的不安，盯着这几个人看，从中还认不出它们将来的主人。
en: What did they see?Two fine animals of a large size that had imprudently ventured on the plateau, when the bridges were open.One would have said they were horses, or at least donkeys, male and female, of a fine shape, dove-colored, the legs and tail white, striped with black on the head and neck.They advanced quietly without showing any uneasiness, and gazed at the men, in whom they could not as yet recognize their future masters.

zh: “这是野驴！”赫伯特喊道，“介于斑驴和斑马之间的动物！”
en: “These are onagers!” cried Herbert, “animals something between the zebra and the quagga!”

zh: “为什么不叫驴子？”纳布问道。
en: “Why not donkeys?” asked Neb.

zh: “因为它们没有长长的耳朵，而且他们的外型更优雅！”
en: “Because they have not long ears, and their shape is more graceful!”

zh: “不管是驴是马，”潘克洛夫打断他说，“他们就是上尉说的‘动力’，既然这样，我们得抓住它们！”
en: “Donkeys or horses,” interrupted Pencroft, “they are ‘moving powers,’ as the captain would say, and as such must be captured!”

zh: 水手在没有惊动动物们的情况下，悄悄爬过草地，来到甘油河上的桥梁边上，把桥放下来，于是野驴就成囚徒了。
en: The sailor, without frightening the animals, crept through the grass to the bridge over Creek Glycerine, lowered it, and the onagers were prisoners.

zh: 那他们是不是应该使用暴力抓住它们，再用武力征服它们呢？不行。他们决定让这两个动物在高地自由地闲逛几天，那里有足够的草。工程师马上就开始在家禽场附近准备一个马厩，野驴在里面可以找到食物，还有舒服的垫子，晚上在这里安身。
en: Now, should they seize them with violence and master them by force?No.It was decided that for a few days they should be allowed to roam freely about the plateau, where there was an abundance of grass, and the engineer immediately began to prepare a stable near the poultry-yard, in which the onagers might find food, with a good litter, and shelter during the night.

zh: 一切完毕后，这两只庞然大物就完全行动自由，居民们为了不让它们受到惊吓，甚至不靠近它们。不过，有几次这两只野驴似乎想离开高地，对于习惯在草原和森林的他们来说，在这里太受限了。接着，他们发现两只野驴开始沿着随处可见的水和栅栏走，发出几声短促的嘶声，在草地上飞奔，然后就变得驯服多了，它们会几个小时都盯着树林，它们永远与那里隔绝了。
en: This done, the movements of the two magnificent creatures were left entirely free, and the settlers avoided even approaching them so as to terrify them.Several times, however, the onagers appeared to wish to leave the plateau, too confined for animals accustomed to the plains and forests.They were then seen following the water-barrier which everywhere presented itself before them, uttering short neighs, then galloping through the grass, and becoming calmer, they would remain entire hours gazing at the woods, from which they were cut off for ever!

zh: 在这期间，他们用蔬菜纤维做成了挽具，捕获野驴几天后，他们不但就准备好了推车，还穿过远西森林开辟出了一条直道，更准确地说是一条近路，它是从慈悲河的拐角处到气球港。他们可以把车子推到那里，十二月底，他们第一次试驾野驴。
en: In the meantime harness of vegetable fiber had been manufactured, and some days after the capture of the onagers, not only the cart was ready, but a straight road, or rather a cutting, had been made through the forests of the Far West, from the angle of the Mercy to Port Balloon.The cart might then be driven there, and towards the end of December they tried the onagers for the first time.

zh: 潘克洛夫已经学会了引诱动物出来吃他手里的食物，也能轻易靠近它们了，但是一放上挽具，它们就暴跳起来，很难控制住。不过，野驴很快就习惯了戴上挽具，它们不像斑马那般倔，在南非的山区，野驴经常要戴上挽具，在欧洲相对比较寒冷的地区也是如此。
en: Pencroft had already coaxed the animals to come and eat out of his hand, and they allowed him to approach without making any difficulty, but once harnessed they reared and could with difficulty be held in.However, it was not long before they submitted to this new service, for the onager, being less refractory than the zebra, is frequently put in harness in the mountainous regions of Southern Africa, and it has even been acclimatized in Europe, under zones of a relative coolness.

zh: 这天，除了潘克洛夫坐在野驴头外，开拓者们都上了车，沿着道路前往气球港。
en: On this day all the colony, except Pencroft who walked at the animals’ heads, mounted the cart, and set out on the road to Port Balloon.

zh: 他们在有些不平的道路上当然会颠簸，但驴车还是平安到达了目的地，很快，他们就往车上装好了气球的气囊和绳索。
en: Of course they were jolted over the somewhat rough road, but the vehicle arrived without any accident, and was soon loaded with the case and rigging of the balloon.

zh: 当天晚上八点，驴车跨过慈悲河上的桥梁后，就顺着河流的左岸下来，停在了沙滩上。他们从野驴身上卸下挽具，然后把它们领到了马厩，睡觉前，潘克洛夫为释放情绪，满意地深深叹了口气，整个花岗石宫都是回声。
en: At eight o’clock that evening the cart, after passing over the Mercy bridge, descended the left bank of the river, and stopped on the beach.The onagers being unharnessed, were thence led to their stable, and Pencroft before going to sleep gave vent to his feelings in a deep sigh of satisfaction that awoke all the echoes of Granite House.

zh: 第八章
en: Chapter 8

zh: 一月的第一个星期，大家都把心思放在了制作开拓者需要的亚麻布衣服上。他们在盒子里找到了针，虽然他们的手指并不纤细，但很有力，可以肯定的是，他们织出来的东西绝对结实。
en: The first week of January was devoted to the manufacture of the linen garments required by the colony.The needles found in the box were used by sturdy if not delicate fingers, and we may be sure that what was sewn was sewn firmly.

zh: 线是有的，多亏了赛勒斯·哈丁的主意，想到可以重新用气球表面上的旧线。吉丁·史佩莱和赫伯特以惊人的耐心把旧线都拆下来了，之前潘克洛夫被迫放弃了这活，因为它超过了潘克洛夫的耐心底线，把他激怒了，不过他在做衣服这方面就没话说了。所有人都知道，水手都确实有非凡的做衣服才能。
en: There was no lack of thread, thanks to Cyrus Harding’s idea of re-employing that which had been already used in the covering of the balloon.This with admirable patience was all unpicked by Gideon Spilett and Herbert, for Pencroft had been obliged to give this work up, as it irritated him beyond measure; but he had no equal in the sewing part of the business.Indeed, everybody knows that sailors have a remarkable aptitude for tailoring.

zh: 他们从焚烧植物的灰里提取出苏打和草碱，再把气囊用的棉布放在里面清洗，用这种方法，棉布的油漆被除去了，恢复了原有的柔软和弹性，然后在风中晾干后，很快就变得雪白。于是，他们做成几十件汗衫和袜子，当然袜子不是针织的，而是用棉布做成的。能再次穿上干净的亚麻布衣，对居民们来说太舒服了。虽然衣服相当粗糙，但他们并没那么挑剔！另外，他们还能在被单里睡觉，花岗石宫的卧榻也变成了相当舒适的床。
en: The cloth of which the balloon-case was made was then cleaned by means of soda and potash, obtained by the incineration of plants, in such a way that the cotton, having got rid of the varnish, resumed its natural softness and elasticity; then, exposed to the action of the atmosphere, it soon became perfectly white.Some dozen shirts and sock—the latter not knitted, of course, but made of cotton—were thus manufactured.What a comfort it was to the settlers to clothe themselves again in clean linen, which was doubtless rather rough, but they were not troubled about that! and then to go to sleep between sheets, which made the couches at Granite House into quite comfortable beds!

zh: 这时，他们还做好了几双海豹皮靴子，从美国穿来的鞋子和靴子太需要换下了。可以肯定的是，这些新鞋足够大，穿上去绝对不会挤脚。
en: It was about this time also that they made boots of seal-leather, which were greatly needed to replace the shoes and boots brought from America.We may be sure that these new shoes were large enough and never pinched the feet of the wearers.

zh: 现在是1868年初，天气非常炎热，但是他们并未因此停止在森林里的打猎。森林里聚集了各种各样的猎物，像刺鼠、野猪、水豚和袋鼠，史佩莱和赫伯特这两位神枪手手法够准，没有浪费掉一发子弹。
en: With the beginning of the year 1866 the heat was very great, but the hunting in the forests did not stand still.Agouties, peccaries, capybaras, kangaroos, game of all sorts, actually swarmed there, and Spilett and Herbert were too good marksmen ever to throw away their shot uselessly.

zh: 不过，赛勒斯·哈丁还是建议他们要节省弹药，他想办法找东西代替放在盒子里的火药和子弹，他希望把它们留着以后使用。如果要离开自己的领地，他怎么会知道命运某天会把他和同伴们抛在哪里呢？所以说，他们得为未知的未来准备着，节省弹药，备好火药，并找到容易更换的替代物。
en: Cyrus Harding still recommended them to husband the ammunition, and he took measures to replace the powder and shot which had been found in the box, and which he wished to reserve for the future.How did he know where chance might one day cast his companions and himself in the event of their leaving their domain?They should, then, prepare for the unknown future by husbanding their ammunition and by substituting for it some easily renewable substance.

zh: 赛勒斯·哈丁在岛上找不到铅的痕迹，所以他用铁粒代替铅，这种铁粒制造起来也比较简单。这种铁粒子弹不像铅子弹那么重，所以他们就把铁粒做得大点，每个弹壳少装点火药，但射击手的好技术弥补了这点缺陷。至于说火药，赛勒斯·哈丁也能做出来，因为他手头上有硝石、硫磺和煤炭，不过制造火药要极度小心谨慎，要是没有特殊工具，想造出好的火药并不容易。因此，哈丁倾向于制造棉花火药，也就是火棉，它里面不一定要放棉花，因为基本的植物纤维都可以用，像大麻、亚麻、纸张和接骨木树心等植物的纤维都行，它们和棉花的纤维都几乎是纯净的。林肯岛上的红河河口就长满了这种接骨木树，它属于忍冬科植物，开拓者们早就用这些灌木的果实做过咖啡喝了。
en: To replace lead, of which Harding had found no traces in the island, he employed granulated iron, which was easy to manufacture.These bullets, not having the weight of leaden bullets, were made larger, and each charge contained less, but the skill of the sportsmen made up this deficiency.As to powder, Cyrus Harding would have been able to make that also, for he had at his disposal saltpeter, sulphur, and coal; but this preparation requires extreme care, and without special tools it is difficult to produce it of a good quality.Harding preferred, therefore, to manufacture pyroxyle, that is to say gun-cotton, a substance in which cotton is not indispensable, as the elementary tissue of vegetables may be used, and this is found in an almost pure state, not only in cotton, but in the textile fiber of hemp and flax, in paper, the pith of the elder, etc.Now, the elder abounded in the island towards the mouth of Red Creek, and the colonists had already made coffee of the berries of these shrubs, which belong to the family of the caprifoliaceae.

zh: 因此，要采集的就只有接骨木的树心，因为制造火棉所需的另外一种物品就是发烟硝酸。现在，哈丁手里有硫酸，只要加入硝石就能轻易得到硝酸，从而大可以为他提供硝石。于是，他决定开始制造火棉以投入使用。虽然火棉有些缺陷，就是说效果不稳定，很容易自燃，它的燃点只有170度，而不是240度，而且，火棉会突然走火，容易损坏枪支。不过从另一方面来讲，火棉也有它的优点，它不容易受潮，也不会弄脏枪筒，而且它的火力是一般火药的四倍。
en: The only thing to be collected, therefore, was elder-pith, for as to the other substance necessary for the manufacture of pyroxyle, it was only fuming azotic acid.Now, Harding having sulphuric acid at his disposal, had already been easily able to produce azotic acid by attacking the saltpeter with which nature supplied him.He accordingly resolved to manufacture and employ pyroxyle, although it has some inconveniences, that is to say, a great inequality of effect, an excessive inflammability, since it takes fire at one hundred and seventy degrees instead of two hundred and forty, and lastly, an instantaneous deflagration which might damage the firearms.On the other hand, the advantages of pyroxyle consist in this, that it is not injured by damp, that it does not make the gun-barrels dirty, and that its force is four times that of ordinary powder.

zh: 若要造出棉花火药，棉花必须在发烟硝酸里浸泡一刻钟，然后在清水中洗净，最后晾干。没有比这更简单的活了。
en: To make pyroxyle, the cotton must be immersed in the fuming azotic acid for a quarter of an hour, then washed in cold water and dried.Nothing could be more simple.

zh: 赛勒斯·哈丁手里只有普通硝酸，而不是所需的发烟硝酸或硝酸单水化合物，这种硝酸一旦与潮湿的空气接触，就会散发出白色的水汽。不过把后一种物质换成普通硝酸，在里面加入三到五倍的高浓度硫酸，工程师也取得了想要的效果。因此，岛上的射击手们很快就拿到了精心准备的火药，由于使用谨慎，它们也发挥出了惊人的效果。
en: Cyrus Harding had only at his disposal the ordinary azotic acid and not the fuming or monohydrate azotic acid, that is to say, acid which emits white vapors when it comes in contact with damp air; but by substituting for the latter ordinary azotic acid, mixed, in the proportion of from three to five volumes of concentrated sulphuric acid, the engineer obtained the same result.The sportsmen of the island therefore soon had a perfectly prepared substance, which, employed discreetly, produced admirable results.

zh: 这时，居民们在高地上开辟出了三英亩的区域，为了野驴着想，剩下的地方保留着原生态。他们去了几次啄木鸟林和远西森林远足，从那里带回来了许多野菜、菠菜、水芹、萝卜和芜菁。只要细心培育，它们很快就能长起来，他们用以维持生计的食物也能得到很好的搭配。成车的木材和煤炭也都用车运来了。每一次出行的同时也意味着马路的修整，车轮的倾轧使马路变得越来越平坦了。
en: About this time the settlers cleared three acres of the plateau, and the rest was preserved in a wild state, for the benefit of the onagers.Several excursions were made into the Jacamar Wood and the forests of the Far West, and they brought back from thence a large collection of wild vegetables, spinach, cress, radishes, and turnips, which careful culture would soon improve, and which would temper the regimen on which the settlers had till then subsisted.Supplies of wood and coal were also carted.Each excursion was at the same time a means of improving the roads, which gradually became smoother under the wheels of the cart.

zh: 养兔场继续为花岗石宫的食物储藏室供应肉类。幸好养兔场坐落在甘油河的对岸，不然里面的动物就要跑到高地，损坏新辟出来的菜地了。岩石中间的蛤蛎场经常补充新的东西，为他们提供了上等软体动物。除此之外，不论是在格兰特湖或是在慈悲河，钓鱼都会有大丰收。因为潘克洛夫做了几条装有铁钩的钓线，于是他们经常抓到美味的鳟鱼，还有一种金色腹部上布满黄色斑点的鱼，这种鱼也极其好吃。擅长烹饪技术的纳布大厨，还懂得适时变换菜单。现在居民们的餐桌上只缺面包了，如前面所说，这是他们特别需要的。
en: The rabbit-warren still continued to supply the larder of Granite House.As fortunately it was situated on the other side of Creek Glycerine, its inhabitants could not reach the plateau nor ravage the newly-made plantation.The oyster-bed among the rocks was frequently renewed and furnished excellent molluscs.Besides that, the fishing, either in the lake or the Mercy, was very profitable, for Pencroft had made some lines, armed with iron hooks, with which they frequently caught fine trout, and a species of fish whose silvery sides were speckled with yellow, and which were also extremely savory.Master Neb, who was skilled in the culinary art, knew how to vary agreeably the bill of fare.Bread alone was wanting at the table of the settlers, and as has been said, they felt this privation greatly.

zh: 居民们还能捕到经常光顾颚角海岸的海龟。这片海滩布满小丘，很好地藏着圆滚滚的海龟蛋。白色的蛋壳很硬，蛋白不像鸟蛋蛋白那样凝结着。海龟蛋会在太阳下孵化，由于每只海龟每年产252个蛋，所以孵出来的海龟数量自然相当可观。
en: The settlers hunted too the turtles which frequented the shores of Cape Mandible.At this place the beach was covered with little mounds, concealing perfectly spherical turtles’ eggs, with white hard shells, the albumen of which does not coagulate as that of birds’ eggs.They were hatched by the sun, and their number was naturally considerable, as each turtle can lay annually two hundred and fifty.

zh: “这是一块普通的海龟蛋集中区，”吉丁·史佩莱说，“看来我们只能把这些蛋捡起来了。”
en: “A regular egg-field,” observed Gideon Spilett, “and we have nothing to do but to pick them up.”

zh: 不过他们并没有满足于只收集海龟蛋，而是开始搜寻产蛋的海龟。终于，他们为花岗石宫带来了十几只海龟，这些动物着实能为居民们增添不少营养。纳布用香草调剂海龟汤，美味的汤赢得了大家的啧啧称赞。
en: But not being contented with simply the produce, they made chase after the producers, the result of which was that they were able to bring back to Granite House a dozen of these chelonians, which were really valuable from an alimentary point of view.The turtle soup, flavored with aromatic herbs, often gained well-merited praises for its preparer, Neb.

zh: 在此我们还得提到另一件幸事，那就是大家找到了可以为冬天储备新食物的地方。成群的鲑鱼游进了慈悲河，并上行了几英里远。这段时间正是雌鱼准备找合适的地方产卵的时节，它们引来了无数雄鱼，在淡水里发出很大声响。一千多条鲑鱼游进了河，它们长2.5英尺。穿过河流的水坝建成后，鱼就更多了。他们抓了一百多条鲑鱼，腌制后就为冬天储藏起来，那时河流结冰，就不能捕鱼了。到这个时候，聪明的贾普已经能够担当仆人的责任了。他穿上了一件夹克，白色亚麻裤，还有一条围裙，上面的口袋是他喜欢的。这个充满灵性的猩猩已经被纳布教导成了训练有素的仆人，任何人都可能会以为，黑人纳布和猩猩说话时，他们能听懂对方的语言。贾普真的很喜欢纳布，纳布对它也是一样。贾普的工作一般是搬木头或爬到树顶，当它不用干这些活时，大部分时间会在厨房里，努力模仿它所看到的纳布的全部工作。黑人纳布在教导这位学生时，相当有耐心，甚至是热情极高，学生也因从主人那里学到的课程而获益，展现了非凡的智慧。
en: We must here mention another fortunate circumstance by which new stores for the winter were laid in.Shoals of salmon entered the Mercy, and ascended the country for several miles.It was the time at which the females, going to find suitable places in which to spawn, precede the males and make a great noise through the fresh water.A thousand of these fish, which measured about two feet and a half in length, came up the river, and a large quantity were retained by fixing dams across the stream.More than a hundred were thus taken, which were salted and stored for the time when winter, freezing up the streams, would render fishing impracticable.By this time the intelligent Jup was raised to the duty of valet.He had been dressed in a jacket, white linen breeches, and an apron, the pockets of which were his delight.The clever orang had been marvelously trained by Neb, and any one would have said that the Negro and the ape understood each other when they talked together.Jup had besides a real affection for Neb, and Neb returned it.When his services were not required, either for carrying wood or for climbing to the top of some tree, Jup passed the greatest part of his time in the kitchen, where he endeavored to imitate Neb in all that he saw him do.The black showed the greatest patience and even extreme zeal in instructing his pupil, and the pupil exhibited remarkable intelligence in profiting by the lessons he received from his master.

zh: 贾普给花岗石宫的居民们带来了意想不到的快乐。有一天，贾普胳膊上挂了一条餐巾，站在餐桌旁准备服侍大家。他动作迅速，神情专注，出色地行使着自己的职责，给大家换盘子、递碟子、倒水，那严肃的神情把大家都乐坏了，潘克洛夫更是笑得前仰后合。
en: Judge then of the pleasure Master Jup gave to the inhabitants of Granite House when, without their having had any idea of it, he appeared one day, napkin on his arm, ready to wait at table.Quick, attentive, he acquitted himself perfectly, changing the plates, bringing dishes, pouring out water, all with a gravity which gave intense amusement to the settlers, and which enraptured Pencroft.

zh: “贾普，上汤！”
en: “Jup, some soup!”

zh: “贾普，来点刺鼠肉！”
en: “Jup, a little agouti!”

zh: “贾普，盘子！”
en: “Jup, a plate!”

zh: “贾普！好贾普！忠实的贾普！”
en: “Jup!Good Jup!Honest Jup!”

zh: 餐桌上只听见这些，不过贾普并没有慌乱，回应每个人的要求，照看着一切，而当潘克洛夫提起见到贾普的第一天开过的玩笑时，贾普摇了摇头，好像听懂了一样。他对贾普说：
en: Nothing was heard but that, and Jup without ever being disconcerted, replied to every one, watched for everything, and he shook his head in a knowing way when Pencroft, referring to his joke of the first day, said to him,—

zh: “贾普，显然我们要让你的薪水翻倍了。”
en: “Decidedly, Jup, your wages must be doubled.”

zh: 毫无疑问，这只猩猩在花岗石宫已经完全被驯服了，它经常陪伴主人去森林，但从未表现出想要离开他们的意思。它走路时，肩上扛着潘克洛夫给他的木棍，就像扛着枪一样，那样子看着非常好笑。他们要是想从树顶摘水果，贾普就很快地爬上去了。如果车轮陷到泥里了，贾普只用他一个肩膀的力量举，车轮就出来了。
en: It is useless to say that the orang was now thoroughly domesticated at Granite House, and that he often accompanied his masters to the forest without showing any wish to leave them.It was most amusing to see him walking with a stick which Pencroft had given him, and which he carried on his shoulder like a gun.If they wished to gather some fruit from the summit of a tree, how quickly he climbed for it.If the wheel of the cart stuck in the mud, with what energy did Jup with a single heave of his shoulder put it right again.

zh: “多可爱的家伙啊！”潘克洛夫经常这么喊，“它要是也相当调皮的话，那我们就拿它没有什么办法了！”
en: “What a jolly fellow he is!” cried Pencroft often.“If he was as mischievous as he is good, there would be no doing anything with him!”

zh: 快到一月底的时候，开拓者们开始在岛屿的中部干活。他们决定在红河发源地附近的富兰克林山脚建一个畜栏，用来圈养反刍动物，它们的出现会为花岗石宫带来一些麻烦，尤其是会侵扰到为居民们的冬衣提供绒毛的摩弗伦羊。
en: It was towards the end of January the colonists began their labors in the center of the island.It had been decided that a corral should be established near the sources of the Red Creek, at the foot of Mount Franklin, destined to contain the ruminants, whose presence would have been troublesome at Granite House, and especially for the musmons, who were to supply the wool for the settlers’ winter garments.

zh: 每天早晨，开拓者们——有时是所有人，但大多数时间都只有哈丁、赫伯特和潘克洛夫三人——会沿着新开辟的路，他们称为畜栏路，来到不到五英里外的红河发源地。
en: Each morning, the colony, sometimes entire, but more often represented only by Harding, Herbert, and Pencroft, proceeded to the sources of the Creek, a distance of not more than five miles, by the newly beaten road to which the name of Corral Road had been given.

zh: 他们选取了富兰克林山南部山脊后的一个地方。这是一块草地，上面到处长着一丛丛树，一条小溪从它一边的山坡上流下来，浇灌着这些树。这里的草很新鲜，四周的树木没有为这些树遮多少荫。他们打算在草地周围建一座相当高的围栏，再矫捷的动物也跳不进去。围栏还要足够大，得容纳一百只摩弗伦羊、野山羊以及将来出生的羊羔。
en: There a site was chosen, at the back of the southern ridge of the mountain.It was a meadow land, dotted here and there with clumps of trees, and watered by a little stream, which sprung from the slopes which closed it in on one side.The grass was fresh, and it was not too much shaded by the trees which grew about it.This meadow was to be surrounded by a palisade, high enough to prevent even the most agile animals from leaping over.This enclosure would be large enough to contain a hundred musmons and wild goats, with all the young ones they might produce.

zh: 工程师划出了畜栏的边界，接着他们就要开始砍伐修栅栏用的树木，不过，由于修路的时候砍了很多树，他们直接裁出了一百个木桩，并把它们牢牢地固定在地上。
en: The perimeter of the corral was then traced by the engineer, and they would then have proceeded to fell the trees necessary for the construction of the palisade, but as the opening up of the road had already necessitated the sacrifice of a considerable number, those were brought and supplied a hundred stakes, which were firmly fixed in the ground.

zh: 修建畜栏花了三个多星期的时间，因为赛勒斯·哈丁不光修了栅栏，还建了大型兽棚，供动物居住。这些兽棚也必须造得非常结实，因为摩弗伦羊力气都很大，第一次见到的它们兽性大发的样子是很吓人的。木桩的顶端都削尖了，用火烤过后也变硬了，他们用横木将木桩钉在一起，每隔一段距离放一个桩子，保证了整个栅栏的稳固。
en: The construction of this corral did not take less than three weeks, for besides the palisade, Cyrus Harding built large sheds, in which the animals could take shelter.These buildings had also to be made very strong, for musmons are powerful animals, and their first fury was to be feared.The stakes, sharpened at their upper end and hardened by fire, had been fixed by means of cross-bars, and at regular distances props assured the solidity of the whole.

zh: 畜栏建成以后，他们就该对经常光顾草地的反刍动物进行搜捕了。他们选定了2月7号，在一个美丽的夏日进行，所有人都出动了。两匹野驴已经训练有素，史佩莱和赫伯特骑着它们，野驴发挥了重要作用。
en: The corral finished, a raid had to be made on the pastures frequented by the ruminants.This was done on the 7th of February, on a beautiful summer’s day, and every one took part in it.The onagers, already well trained, were ridden by Spilett and Herbert, and were of great use.

zh: 他们的策略很简单，就是围住摩弗伦羊和山羊，然后逐渐缩小包围圈。赛勒斯·哈丁、潘克洛夫、纳布和贾普都各自在树林里找地方守好了，而两位骑士和托普则在畜栏周边半英里范围内飞奔。
en: The maneuver consisted simply in surrounding the musmons and goats, and gradually narrowing the circle around them.Cyrus Harding, Pencroft, Neb, and Jup, posted themselves in different parts of the wood, while the two cavaliers and Top galloped in a radius of half a mile round the corral.

zh: 荒岛上的这块地方有相当多的摩弗伦羊。这种优等动物的体积和鹿一般大，它们的角比公绵羊角要硬，灰色的底绒里还掺杂着长毛。
en: The musmons were very numerous in this part of the island.These fine animals were as large as deer; their horns were stronger than those of the ram, and their gray-colored fleece was mixed with long hair.

zh: 打了一天猎很是累人。他们来回奔跑，骑着野驴，还要大声喊叫！他们包围了一百只摩弗伦羊，虽然三分之二以上的都逃走了，但他们最后还是得到了30只，另外，10只野山羊也慢慢被赶到畜栏口，开口处看似提供了逃跑通道，它们跑进里面，成为了囚徒。
en: This hunting day was very fatiguing.Such going and coming, and running and riding and shouting!Of a hundred musmons which had been surrounded, more than two-thirds escaped, but at last, thirty of these animals and ten wild goats were gradually driven back towards the corral, the open door of which appearing to offer a means of escape, they rushed in and were prisoners.

zh: 总之，最终的收获是很令人满意的，居民们也没有什么好抱怨的。有了这肯定会不断繁殖的一群动物，在不远的将来，不光是棉毛，就连皮革也会源源不断了。
en: In short, the result was satisfactory, and the settlers had no reason to complain.There was no doubt that the flock would prosper, and that at no distant time not only wool but hides would be abundant.

zh: 当天晚上，猎人们回到了花岗石宫，他们已经筋疲力竭了。不过，他们虽然很累，第二天还是要去看一下畜栏。里面的俘虏们试图越过栅栏，不过当然是不会成功的，很快它们就变得温顺多了。
en: That evening the hunters returned to Granite House quite exhausted.However, notwithstanding their fatigue, they returned the next day to visit the corral.The prisoners had been trying to overthrow the palisade, but of course had not succeeded, and were not long in becoming more tranquil.

zh: 整个二月都没有什么重要的事发生。大家每天有条不紊地干活，修整通往畜栏和气球港的路，还开始修建第三条路，从围栏延伸至西部海岸。目前林肯岛上的未知区域就是树木覆盖的盘蛇半岛，里面住着野兽，吉丁·史佩莱特别想把它们从领地上清出去。
en: During the month of February, no event of any importance occurred.The daily labors were pursued methodically, and, as well as improving the roads to the corral and to Port Balloon, a third was commenced, which, starting from the enclosure, proceeded towards the western coast.The yet unknown portion of Lincoln Island was that of the wood-covered Serpentine Peninsula, which sheltered the wild beasts, from which Gideon Spilett was so anxious to clear their domain.

zh: 在寒冷的季节到来之前，他们的主要任务就是精心培育从森林移植到眺望岗的野生植物。赫伯特每次出行都会带回来一些有用的蔬菜。有时候，他会带回来一些菊苣类植物的标本，这种植物的籽可以压制成上好的油；有时他还会带回来一些常见的酸模，它们具有治疗坏血病的功效，是不容忽视的；还有的时候，他会带回来珍稀块茎，它们一般都种在南美，还有马铃薯，目前其种类已经超过200种。现在菜园里有各种各样的蔬菜，经过小心防卫，没有鸟类侵害，地被分为小块，上面种着莴苣、肾形红皮马铃薯、酸模、芜菁、萝卜和其他十字花科植物。高地上的土壤相当肥沃，丰收是很有希望的。
en: Before the cold season should appear the most assiduous care was given to the cultivation of the wild plants which had been transplanted from the forest to Prospect Heights.Herbert never returned from an excursion without bringing home some useful vegetable.One day, it was some specimens of the chicory tribe, the seeds of which by pressure yield an excellent oil; another, it was some common sorrel, whose antiscorbutic qualities were not to be despised; then, some of those precious tubers, which have at all times been cultivated in South America, potatoes, of which more than two hundred species are now known.The kitchen garden, now well stocked and carefully defended from the birds, was divided into small beds, where grew lettuces, kidney potatoes, sorrel, turnips, radishes, and other coneiferae.The soil on the plateau was particularly fertile, and it was hoped that the harvests would be abundant.

zh: 他们还有各种各样的饮料，只要不想喝酒，即便最难取悦的人也没有理由抱怨。除了大红香蜂草茶，以及从麒麟树树根中提取发酵的酒以外，哈丁还酿造了一种啤酒，他将冷云杉的嫩芽放在水里煮沸后再发酵，最后就做成了被英裔美国人称为泉水啤酒的可口饮品。
en: They had also a variety of different beverages, and so long as they did not demand wine, the most hard to please would have had no reason to complain.To the Oswego tea, and the fermented liquor extracted from the roots of the dragonnier, Harding had added a regular beer, made from the young shoots of the spruce-fir, which, after having been boiled and fermented, made that agreeable drink called by the Anglo-Americans spring-beer.

zh: 夏天快结束的时候，家禽场里有了一对优良的大鸨，它们属于鸨类，其特别之处在于身上长满了羽毛；还有十几只琵嘴鸭，它们的上颚两边都长了片长膜；还有几只美丽的公鸡，这种鸡和莫桑比克公鸡很像，它的鸡冠、肉垂和表皮都是黑色的。到目前为止，在这几位智勇双全的男士的辛勤劳作下，一切都很顺利。虽然大自然无疑为他们准备了很多，但他们还是秉持自己的原则，充分利用造物主慷慨的赐予。
en: Towards the end of the summer, the poultry-yard was possessed of a couple of fine bustards, which belonged to the houbara species, characterized by a sort of feathery mantle; a dozen shovelers, whose upper mandible was prolonged on each side by a membraneous appendage; and also some magnificent cocks, similar to the Mozambique cocks, the comb, caruncle, and epidermis being black.So far, everything had succeeded, thanks to the activity of these courageous and intelligent men.Nature did much for them, doubtless; but faithful to the great precept, they made a right use of what a bountiful Providence gave them.

zh: 在炎热的夏季里，夜间当高温离去的时候，海风徐徐吹来，他们干完活后喜欢坐在眺望岗的边缘上，这里已经被纳布用爬藤盖住，改造成了小阳台。他们相互交谈，给对方提意见，还会规划未来，而水手那蹩脚的幽默感常常为这个小世界带来快乐，在这里，人们相处得总是很融洽。
en: After the heat of these warm summer days, in the evening when their work was finished and the sea-breeze began to blow, they liked to sit on the edge of Prospect Heights, in a sort of veranda, covered with creepers, which Neb had made with his own hands.There they talked, they instructed each other, they made plans, and the rough good-humor of the sailor always amused this little world, in which the most perfect harmony had never ceased to reign.

zh: 他们经常谈起自己的祖国，伟大而可爱的美国。南北战争的结果怎么样了？战争不可能持续太久。里士满肯定很快就要落入格兰特将军的手里。南部联邦的首府被攻破肯定是这场可怕的战争的最终结局。现在北方军取得了正义的胜利，这些逃到林肯岛上的居民们是多么想要一份报纸啊！11个月以来，他们与其他同胞的联系都被阻断了，3月24号很快就要来了，那天是他们被气球扔到这个未知海岸的纪念日。那一天，他们变成了落难者，在恶劣天气的肆虐下，他们都不知道该如何保全自己的不幸生命。可是现在，在上尉丰富的经验和同伴各自智慧的帮助下，他们已经有各种武器、工具和设备，成为了岛上的正式居民。他们还学会了利用荒岛上的动物、植物和矿产，也就是自然界的三大物类。
en: They often spoke of their country, of their dear and great America.What was the result of the War of Secession?It could not have been greatly prolonged.Richmond had doubtless soon fallen into the hands of General Grant.The taking of the capital of the Confederates must have been the last action of this terrible struggle.Now the North had triumphed in the good cause, how welcome would have been a newspaper to the exiles in Lincoln Island!For eleven months all communication between them and the rest of their fellow-creatures had been interrupted, and in a short time the 24th of March would arrive, the anniversary of the day on which the balloon had thrown them on this unknown coast.They were then mere castaways, not even knowing how they should preserve their miserable lives from the fury of the elements!And now, thanks to the knowledge of their captain, and their own intelligence, they were regular colonists, furnished with arms, tools, and instruments; they had been able to turn to their profit the animals, plants, and minerals of the island, that is to say, the three kingdoms of Nature.

zh: 是的，他们常常会谈起这些，还会做更多的规划。
en: Yes; they often talked of all these things and formed still more plans.

zh: 赛勒斯·哈丁大部分时间都很安静，他总是聆听伙伴们说的话，说的却比较少。有时赫伯特会想出新点子，抑或潘克洛夫说出不着边际的话，他都会笑一笑，不管在哪里，他总在思考那些难以解释的事实，可他至今还没有猜透里面的谜！
en: As to Cyrus Harding he was for the most part silent, and listened to his companions more often than he spoke to them.Sometimes he smiled at Herbert’s ideas or Pencroft’s nonsense, but always and everywhere he pondered over those inexplicable facts, that strange enigma, of which the secret still escaped him!

zh: 第九章
en: Chapter 9

zh: 三月的第一个星期，天气有了变化。月初的时候，月亮还很圆，天气也很热。大气里似乎充斥着电流，恐怕未来几天要有暴风雨了。
en: The weather changed during the first week of March.There had been a full moon at the commencement of the month, and the heat was excessive.The atmosphere was felt to be full of electricity, and a period of some length of tempestuous weather was to be feared.

zh: 果然不出所料，3月2号那天，隆隆的雷声传来，狂风从东边刮过来，冰雹像齐射的葡萄弹似的打在花岗石宫的表面上。他们赶紧关上门窗，不然屋里所有的东西都要弄湿了。这些冰雹有的像鸽子蛋那么大，潘克洛夫一下子就想到他的庄稼地有危险了。
en: Indeed, on the 2nd, peals of thunder were heard, the wind blew from the east, and hail rattled against the facade of Granite House like volleys of grape-shot.The door and windows were immediately closed, or everything in the rooms would have been drenched.On seeing these hailstones, some of which were the size of a pigeon’s egg, Pencroft’s first thought was that his cornfield was in serious danger.

zh: 他立马就跑到了庄稼地，里面的庄稼都冒出小绿苗了，他拿了很大一块布遮挡，保护他的庄稼。
en: He directly rushed to his field, where little green heads were already appearing, and by means of a great cloth, he managed to protect his crop.

zh: 糟糕的天气持续了一个星期，在这几天，雷声总是不绝于耳地从高空传来。
en: This bad weather lasted a week, during which time the thunder rolled without cessation in the depths of the sky.

zh: 开拓者们没有什么迫切需要出去做的事，所以就趁天气不好的时候在花岗石宫里面干活，一天天过去了，屋子里的布置越来越完备了。工程师造出了一台车床，并用它做了几件厕所和厨房的用具，特别是他们现在紧缺的纽扣。他还造了一个放置火器的枪炮，并小心翼翼地保管好，桌子和橱柜也都不缺了。他们锯的锯，刨的刨，锉的锉，铣的铣，在天气糟糕的这段时间里，只有打磨工具的声音和车床的嗡嗡声，回应着轰隆隆的雷声。
en: The colonists, not having any pressing work out of doors, profited by the bad weather to work at the interior of Granite House, the arrangement of which was becoming more complete from day to day.The engineer made a turning-lathe, with which he turned several articles both for the toilet and the kitchen, particularly buttons, the want of which was greatly felt.A gunrack had been made for the firearms, which were kept with extreme care, and neither tables nor cupboards were left incomplete.They sawed, they planed, they filed, they turned; and during the whole of this bad season, nothing was heard but the grinding of tools or the humming of the turning-lathe which responded to the growling of the thunder.

zh: 大伙也没有忘了贾普，他在后院的储藏室边有一间自己的屋子，这个房间有点像船舱，里面的吊床装满了合他胃口的干草。
en: Master Jup had not been forgotten, and he occupied a room at the back, near the storeroom, a sort of cabin with a cot always full of good litter, which perfectly suited his taste.

zh: “好杰普从来不吵嘴，”潘克洛夫经常这样夸赞道，“也不会强辩。多好的仆人，纳布，多好的仆人啊！”
en: “With good old Jup there is never any quarreling,” often repeated Pencroft, “never any improper reply.What a servant, Neb, what a servant!”

zh: 当然，贾普现在很习惯给大家服务了。它给大伙刷衣服、烤肉、伺候大家吃饭、打扫房间、采集木材，它的另外一项贴心服务更是让潘克洛夫相当满意，那就是不把可敬的水手伺候得上床睡觉，它是绝不会先睡的。
en: Of course Jup was now well used to service.He brushed their clothes, he turned the spit, he waited at table, he swept the rooms, he gathered wood, and he performed another admirable piece of service which delighted Pencroft—he never went to sleep without first coming to tuck up the worthy sailor in his bed.

zh: 至于说开拓地成员们的健康，不论两足动物还是两手动物、四手类或四足类，都还挺健壮。户外的生活，有益健康的的土壤，温带气候，加之体力与脑力活动相结合，他们也就不可能想到疾病会侵袭自己。
en: As to the health of the members of the colony, bipeds or bimana, quadrumana or quadrupeds, it left nothing to be desired.With their life in the open air, on this salubrious soil, under that temperate zone, working both with head and hands, they could not suppose that illness would ever attack them.

zh: 大家的确也都非常健康。赫伯特这一年长了两英尺。他的身体逐渐发育，很快就变得更像个大人了，他还立志要让自己成为德才兼备、身强体健的全能之才。一干完体力活，他就在空闲时间提升自己。箱子里的书他都翻来看了，除了实际的生活需要获取知识外，他还向工程师学习科学，向记者学习语言，这些老师都是很乐意把他教育好的。
en: All were indeed wonderfully well.Herbert had already grown two inches in the year.His figure was forming and becoming more manly, and he promised to be an accomplished man, physically as well as morally.Besides he improved himself during the leisure hours which manual occupations left to him; he read the books found in the case; and after the practical lessons which were taught by the very necessity of their position, he found in the engineer for science, and the reporter for languages, masters who were delighted to complete his education.

zh: 3月9号这天，暴风雨过去了，不过，夏季的最后一个月里天空一直布满云朵。空气由于雷电天气的影响，被剧烈搅动着，不再像先前那么纯净了。除了外出打猎那三四天的天气比较晴朗以外，其他时间一直都是下雨或起雾。这时候，母驴也生了一头小母驴，小驴子长得很快。畜栏里的摩弗伦羊群也变多了，几只羊羔已经在兽棚里咩咩叫喊起来，纳布和赫伯特听了都非常高兴，在这群新来者中，他们各有自己最喜欢的羊羔。另外，居民们还试着驯化野猪，最后的结果也都挺成功。家禽场下面还建了一个猪圈，很快里面就有了几只猪崽，它们逐渐变得开化了，也就是说，在纳布的照料下愈来愈肥了。贾普负责每天给猪崽喂饲料、厨房的剩菜剩饭等等，它干得十分尽心。有时候它会拿猪崽逗乐，拽它们的尾巴玩，不过这只是淘气，不能说是残忍，它把这些小尾巴都当成好玩的东西了，贾普的天性就和孩子一样。就在三月的一天，潘克洛夫在和工程师说话的时候，正好提醒了赛勒斯·哈丁一件他允诺过的事，但后来还没有时间完成。
en: The tempest ended about the 9th of March, but the sky remained covered with clouds during the whole of this last summer month.The atmosphere, violently agitated by the electric commotions, could not recover its former purity, and there was almost invariably rain and fog, except for three or four fine days on which several excursions were made.About this time the female onager gave birth to a young one which belonged to the same sex as its mother, and which throve capitally.In the corral, the flock of musmons had also increased, and several lambs already bleated in the sheds, to the great delight of Neb and Herbert, who had each their favorite among these newcomers.An attempt was also made for the domestication of the peccaries, which succeeded well.A sty was constructed under the poultry-yard, and soon contained several young ones in the way to become civilized, that is to say, to become fat under Neb’s care.Master Jup, entrusted with carrying them their daily nourishment, leavings from the kitchen, etc., acquitted himself conscientiously of his task.He sometimes amused himself at the expense of his little pensioners by tweaking their tails; but this was mischief, and not wickedness, for these little twisted tails amused him like a plaything, and his instinct was that of a child.One day in this month of March, Pencroft, talking to the engineer, reminded Cyrus Harding of a promise which the latter had not as yet had time to fulfil.

zh: “上尉，你说过一种仪器，将代替花岗石宫的长梯，”潘克洛夫说，“你以后不做它了吗？”
en: “You once spoke of an apparatus which would take the place of the long ladders at Granite House, captain,” said he; “won’t you make it some day?”

zh: “这个再简单不过了，不过它真的有用吗？”
en: “Nothing will be easier; but is this a really useful thing?”

zh: “当然了，上尉。我们的必需品都自给自足后，让我们想点奢侈的东西。对我们来说这或许是奢侈品，如果你这样想，可是对搬运东西来说，那就是必需品了。背着沉重的东西爬那么长的梯子，实在是很不方便。”
en: “Certainly, captain.After we have given ourselves necessaries, let us think a little of luxury.For us it may be luxury, if you like, but for things it is necessary.It isn’t very convenient to climb up a long ladder when one is heavily loaded.”

zh: “好吧，潘克洛夫，我们会让你满意的。”赛勒斯·哈丁回答说。
en: “Well, Pencroft, we will try to please you,” replied Cyrus Harding.

zh: “可是你手头没有机器！”
en: “But you have no machine at your disposal.”

zh: “我们可以造一个。”
en: “We will make one.”

zh: “一个蒸汽机？”
en: “A steam machine?”

zh: “不对，是一架水压机。”
en: “No, a water machine.”

zh: 事实上，工程师手中有现成的自然力，他可以毫不费劲地借助这种力量使装置运转。为此，只要增强供应花岗石宫内部用水的小水流，就足够了。工程师拓宽了石头与草地之间的开口，使得通道底部形成了湍急的瀑布，通道里漫出来的水最后由地下井流出去了。工程师在瀑布的下方装了一个带有螺旋桨的圆筒，和外面的轮盘连接在一起，轮盘上缠绕着一根结实的绳索，而绳索下面则挂着一个吊篮。这样一来，他们就可以通过一根接触地面的绳子调节动力，继而乘坐吊篮一直升到花岗石宫门口。
en: And, indeed, to work his apparatus there was already a natural force at the disposal of the engineer which could be used without great difficulty.For this, it was enough to augment the flow of the little stream which supplied the interior of Granite House with water.The opening among the stones and grass was then increased, thus producing a strong fall at the bottom of the passage, the overflow from which escaped by the inner well.Below this fall the engineer fixed a cylinder with paddles, which was joined on the exterior with a strong cable rolled on a wheel, supporting a basket.In this way, by means of a long rope reaching to the ground, which enabled them to regulate the motive power, they could rise in the basket to the door of Granite House.

zh: 就在3月17号这天，升降梯第一次投入使用，大家对结果都非常满意。从这以后，升降机代替了原有的梯子，包括木材、煤炭、食物，甚至连居民在内的所有重物都可以通过这个简易装置上上下下了，可想而知，没有人对这项改变后悔。托普对装置的改进更是兴奋不已，因为此前它没有、也绝不会有贾普那样的爬梯技术，而只能趴在纳布后背，或是猩猩的后背，才能登上花岗石宫。这时赛勒斯·哈丁也想尝试做一些玻璃，他先是把那只旧的陶土炉子用在了这个新任务上。虽然也遇到了一些困难，但经过几次失败的尝试之后，他成功搭建出了一个玻璃工厂，吉丁·史佩莱和赫伯特这两位老助手，好几天都没有离开过他身边。用来制作玻璃的材料只是些沙子、白垩、苏打、碳酸盐或硫酸盐。现在海滩上有沙子，石灰里有白垩，海藻里有苏打，黄铁矿里有硫酸，地里有煤，可以用来将陶土炉子加热到需要的温度。赛勒斯·哈丁很快就准备好了开工所需的一切东西。
en: It was on the 17th of March that the lift acted for the first time, and gave universal satisfaction.Henceforward all the loads, wood, coal, provisions, and even the settlers themselves, were hoisted by this simple system, which replaced the primitive ladder, and, as may be supposed, no one thought of regretting the change.Top particularly was enchanted with this improvement, for he had not, and never could have possessed Master Jup’s skill in climbing ladders, and often it was on Neb’s back, or even on that of the orang that he had been obliged to make the ascent to Granite House.About this time, too, Cyrus Harding attempted to manufacture glass, and he at first put the old pottery-kiln to this new use.There were some difficulties to be encountered; but, after several fruitless attempts, he succeeded in setting up a glass manufactory, which Gideon Spilett and Herbert, his usual assistants, did not leave for several days.As to the substances used in the composition of glass, they are simply sand, chalk, and soda, either carbonate or sulphate.Now the beach supplied sand, lime supplied chalk, sea-weeds supplied soda, pyrites supplied sulphuric acid, and the ground supplied coal to heat the kiln to the wished-for temperature.Cyrus Harding thus soon had everything ready for setting to work.

zh: 最难制造的工具就是制玻璃的管子，这种铁管长约五、六英尺，一端用来蘸取熔化状态的材料。不过，潘克洛夫将一条又长又薄的铁片卷成了枪筒形，这样就做成了一根可以马上使用的管子了。
en: The tool, the manufacture of which presented the most difficulty, was the pipe of the glass-maker, an iron tube, five or six feet long, which collects on one end the material in a state of fusion.But by means of a long, thin piece of iron rolled up like the barrel of a gun, Pencroft succeeded in making a tube soon ready for use.

zh: 3月28号这天，他们加热了这根管子。他们将100份沙子、35份白垩、40份硫酸钠及两、三份煤屑掺好后放在了钳锅里。当陶土炉子里的高温将原料加热熔化为液体,更确切地说是胶状物的时候，赛勒斯·哈丁先用吹管蘸了一些，然后把吹管在预先放置的金属板上滚来滚去，好让它的形状更适合吹制玻璃，接着他把吹管递给了赫伯特，叫他吹另一端。
en: On the 28th of March the tube was heated.A hundred parts of sand, thirty-five of chalk, forty of sulphate of soda, mixed with two or three parts of powdered coal, composed the substance, which was placed in crucibles.When the high temperature of the oven had reduced it to a liquid, or rather a pasty state, Cyrus Harding collected with the tube a quantity of the paste: he turned it about on a metal plate, previously arranged, so as to give it a form suitable for blowing, then he passed the tube to Herbert, telling him to blow at the other extremity.

zh: 赫伯特鼓起两颊，使劲往管子里吹，同时认真地旋转吹管，玻璃就这样被吹得膨胀起来了。他们又在刚制成的玻璃物上涂了层同样的胶状物，很快就制成了直径达一英尺的玻璃球。然后，哈丁把赫伯特手里的吹管拿过来，不停地来回摆动，这个柔顺的玻璃球就被拉长了，变成了圆柱形。
en: And Herbert, swelling out his cheeks, blew so much and so well into the tube-taking care to twirl it round at the same time—that his breath dilated the glassy mass.Other quantities of the substance in a state of fusion were added to the first, and in a short time the result was a bubble which measured a foot in diameter.Harding then took the tube out of Herbert’s hands, and, giving it a pendulous motion, he ended by lengthening the malleable bubble so as to give it a cylindroconic shape.

zh: 吹的工序完成后，将锋利的铁片放在冷水里浸湿，就能轻易地去掉两头的半圆形帽子，这样就做成了一个玻璃圆筒。他们还用同样的方法将圆筒直着割开，再经过一次加热使玻璃软化，然后把它平铺在板子上，用木滚子碾开。
en: The blowing operation had given a cylinder of glass terminated by two hemispheric caps, which were easily detached by means of a sharp iron dipped in cold water; then, by the same proceeding, this cylinder was cut lengthways, and after having been rendered malleable by a second heating, it was extended on a plate and spread out with a wooden roller.

zh: 第一块玻璃就这样做好了，他们只需要将这个方法重复50次就能得到50块玻璃。花岗石宫的窗户很快就装上了玻璃，虽然它们也许不太纯净，但还是足够透明了。
en: The first pane was thus manufactured, and they had only to perform this operation fifty times to have fifty panes.The windows at Granite House were soon furnished with panes; not very white, perhaps, but still sufficiently transparent.

zh: 至于做瓶子和平底无脚酒杯，那就更不是问题了。当这些东西从吹管的末端成型的时候，他们都非常得意。潘克洛夫请求让他“吹”一次，对他来说这是很有趣的事情，不过他吹得太用力了，最后出来的东西都奇形怪状，可他自己非常欣赏。
en: As to bottles and tumblers, that was only play.They were satisfied with them, besides, just as they came from the end of the tube.Pencroft had asked to be allowed to “blow” in his turn, and it was great fun for him; but he blew so hard that his productions took the most ridiculous shapes, which he admired immensely.

zh: 一天，赛勒斯·哈丁和赫伯特出去打猎，进入了慈悲河左岸的远西森林，少年和往常一样问了无数个问题，而工程师则热心地一一予以回答。现在，哈丁不是猎人，另一方面，赫伯特谈论的尽是化学和物理学，于是许多袋鼠、水豚和刺鼠虽然来到射程之内，但逃过了少年的枪口，结果一天的时间都要过去了，两人却可能进行了一次无用的远足，这时赫伯特停下来，发出喜悦的叫声，喊道：
en: Cyrus Harding and Herbert, while hunting one day, had entered the forest of the Far West, on the left bank of the Mercy, and, as usual, the lad was asking a thousand questions of the engineer, who answered them heartily.Now, as Harding was not a sportsman, and as, on the other side, Herbert was talking chemistry and natural philosophy, numbers of kangaroos, capybaras, and agouties came within range, which, however, escaped the lad’s gun; the consequence was that the day was already advanced, and the two hunters were in danger of having made a useless excursion, when Herbert, stopping, and uttering a cry of joy, exclaimed,—

zh: “噢，哈丁上尉，你看见那棵树了吗？”他指着一棵灌木，而不是一棵树，因为它只有一根树茎，外面包着一层鳞状树皮，上面长着少许平行脉的叶子。
en: “Oh, Captain Harding, do you see that tree?” and he pointed to a shrub, rather than a tree, for it was composed of a single stem, covered with a scaly bark, which bore leaves streaked with little parallel veins.

zh: “这棵树长得很像小棕榈树，它叫什么名字？”哈丁问道。
en: “And what is this tree which resembles a little palm?” asked Harding.

zh: “它叫‘凤尾松’，在我们的《博物学大辞典》里有一张它的照片！”赫伯特说。
en: “It is a ‘cycas revoluta,’ of which I have a picture in our dictionary of Natural History!” said Herbert.

zh: “可是我没看见上面有果实啊！”他的同伴说。
en: “But I can’t see any fruit on this shrub!” observed his companion.

zh: “的确没有，上尉，”赫伯特回答说，“不过它的树茎里有一种粉末，是大自然都给我们准备好的。”
en: “No, captain,” replied Herbert; “but its stem contains a flour with which nature has provided us all ready ground.”

zh: “那它就是面包树了？”
en: “It is, then, the bread-tree?”

zh: “对，面包树。”
en: “Yes, the bread-tree.”

zh: “太好了，孩子，”工程师说，“这个发现太有价值了，因为我们的麦子还没有成熟，我希望你没有弄错啊！”
en: “Well, my boy,” replied the engineer, “this is a valuable discovery, since our wheat harvest is not yet ripe; I hope that you are not mistaken!”

zh: 赫伯特确实没有弄错，他把一棵凤尾松的树干折断，里面是由腺状组织构成，藏着许多粉状木髓，木状纤维从中穿过，同样由粉末构成的同心圆年轮则将它们分隔开来。这种淀粉里混杂了一种气味难闻的粘液，不过可以很容易地被挤压掉。这种细胞质的东西是上等面粉，营养极其丰富，以前日本法律是禁止它出口的。
en: Herbert was not mistaken: he broke the stem of a cycas, which was composed of a glandulous tissue, containing a quantity of floury pith, traversed with woody fiber, separated by rings of the same substance, arranged concentrically.With this fecula was mingled a mucilaginous juice of disagreeable flavor, but which it would be easy to get rid of by pressure.This cellular substance was regular flour of a superior quality, extremely nourishing; its exportation was formerly forbidden by the Japanese laws.

zh: 赛勒斯·哈丁和赫伯特查看完远西森林里生长凤尾松的那块地方，并做了标记，然后回到花岗石宫，向大家宣布了他们的发现。
en: Cyrus Harding and Herbert, after having examined that part of the Far West where the cycas grew, took their bearings, and returned to Granite House, where they made known their discovery.

zh: 第二天居民们出去采集了一番，回来就给花岗石宫添了足够使用的凤尾松树茎。工程师做了一台压榨机，用来清除淀粉中混杂的粘液，然后就得到了大量的面粉，很快纳布就用面粉做成了布丁和蛋糕。这还不是真正小麦制成的面包，不过已经差不多了。
en: The next day the settlers went to collect some, and returned to Granite House with an ample supply of cycas stems.The engineer constructed a press, with which to extract the mucilaginous juice mingled with the fecula, and he obtained a large quantity of flour, which Neb soon transformed into cakes and puddings.This was not quite real wheaten bread, but it was very like it.

zh: 现在，畜栏里的野驴、山羊、绵羊每天也能为居民们提供所需的鲜奶了。推车，确切地说已经被一辆轻型兽力车代替，经常驶去畜栏那里。当轮到潘克洛夫去的时候，他都会带上贾普，让他赶车，贾普挥舞着鞭子，像以往一样表现着自己的智慧。
en: Now, too, the onager, the goats, and the sheep in the corral furnished daily the milk necessary to the colony.The cart, or rather a sort of light carriole which had replaced it, made frequent journeys to the corral, and when it was Pencroft’s turn to go he took Jup, and let him drive, and Jup, cracking his whip, acquitted himself with his customary intelligence.

zh: 不论是花岗石宫还是畜栏，一切都欣欣向荣，除了远离家乡之外，居民们已经没有什么可抱怨了。他们都已经非常适应这种生活，也很习惯这个岛屿，若是让他们离开这片熟悉的土地，还真不太舍得。
en: Everything prospered, as well in the corral as in Granite House, and certainly the settlers, if it had not been that they were so far from their native land, had no reason to complain.They were so well suited to this life, and were, besides, so accustomed to the island, that they could not have left its hospitable soil without regret!

zh: 不过，他们对祖国的热爱却已根植在心中，如果有船突然出现在岛屿的视线范围中，他们就会发出信号吸引船员的注意，然后离开这座岛。
en: And yet so deeply is the love of his country implanted in the heart of man, that if a ship had unexpectedly come in sight of the island, the colonists would have made signals, would have attracted her attention, and would have departed!

zh: 4月1号是星期天，也是复活节，哈丁和同伴们通过休息和祷告过节。这一天天气很好，可能像北半球十月份的天气。
en: It was the 1st of April, a Sunday, Easter Day, which Harding and his companions sanctified by rest and prayer.The day was fine, such as an October day in the Northern Hemisphere might be.

zh: 傍晚吃过晚饭后，大伙都坐在眺望岗边缘的平台上，注视着逐渐被黑暗吞噬的地平线。纳布给大家端来了几杯接骨木种子的饮料，用这个代替咖啡喝。他们谈起了这座荒岛以及它在太平洋上孤立的地理位置，这引得吉丁·史佩莱问道：
en: All, towards the evening after dinner, were seated under the veranda on the edge of Prospect Heights, and they were watching the darkness creeping up from the horizon.Some cups of the infusion of elder-berries, which took the place of coffee, had been served by Neb.They were speaking of the island and of its isolated situation in the Pacific, which led Gideon Spilett to say,—

zh: “亲爱的赛勒斯，自从你在箱子里找到六分仪后，你有没有重新测定这座岛屿的位置？”
en: “My dear Cyrus, have you ever, since you possessed the sextant found in the case, again taken the position of our island?”

zh: “没有。”工程师回答说。
en: “No,” replied the engineer.

zh: “不过也许用这个仪器量更好，它可比你以前用的那个东西好多了。”
en: “But it would perhaps be a good thing to do it with this instrument, which is more perfect than that which you before used.”

zh: “那有什么用？”潘克洛夫问，“荒岛不还是在那儿呆着吗！”
en: “What is the good?” said Pencroft.“The island is quite comfortable where it is!”

zh: “那谁能知道呢，”记者回答说，“也许我们与有人居住的陆地的距离比我们想象中的要近得多呢？这谁又知道？”
en: “Well, who knows,” returned the reporter, “who knows but that we may be much nearer inhabited land than we think?”

zh: “明天我们就能知道了，”赛勒斯回答说，“要不是因为事情太多抽不出时间，我们早就能知道了。”
en: “We shall know to-morrow,” replied Cyrus Harding, “and if it had not been for the occupations which left me no leisure, we should have known it already.”

zh: “太好了！”潘克洛夫说，“上尉可是顶棒的测量家，他肯定不会错，除非荒岛自己从它的位置上移动了，不然它肯定还在上次标记的地方。”
en: “Good!” said Pencroft.“The captain is too good an observer to be mistaken, and, if it has not moved from its place, the island is just where he put it.”

zh: “我们拭目以待吧。”
en: “We shall see.”

zh: 因此，第二天，工程师用六分仪进行了必要的测量，从而证实他已经得知的位置，下面就是他测量后得到的结果。第一次测量使他得到了林肯岛的位置：
en: On the next day, therefore, by means of the sextant, the engineer made the necessary observations to verify the position which he had already obtained, and this was the result of his operation.His first observation had given him the situation of Lincoln Island,—

zh: 西经150度至157度；
en: In west longitude: from 150 to 155;

zh: 南纬30度至35度。
en: In south latitude: from 30 to 35

zh: 第二次测量的结果就精确了：
en: The second gave exactly:

zh: 西经150度30分；
en: In longitude: 150 30’

zh: 南纬34度57分。
en: In south latitude: 34 57’

zh: 虽然上次使用的仪器不够完备，但赛勒斯·哈丁精湛的测量技术使得最后的测量误差不超过5度。
en: So then, notwithstanding the imperfection of his apparatus, Cyrus Harding had operated with so much skill that his error did not exceed five degrees.

zh: “现在，”吉丁·史佩莱说，“既然我们有了地图和六分仪，亲爱的赛勒斯，就让我们看看林肯岛在太平洋的精确位置吧。”
en: “Now,” said Gideon Spilett, “since we possess an atlas as well as a sextant, let us see, my dear Cyrus, the exact position which Lincoln Island occupies in the Pacific.”

zh: 赫伯特拿来地图，将太平洋那部分展开，工程师手里则拿着指南针，准备进行定位。
en: Herbert fetched the atlas, and the map of the Pacific was opened, and the engineer, compass in hand, prepared to determine their position.

zh: 突然，指南针停住不动了，他大声喊道：
en: Suddenly the compasses stopped, and he exclaimed,

zh: “太平洋的这个地方早就有一个岛了！”
en: “But an island exists in this part of the Pacific already!”

zh: “有一个岛？”潘克洛夫大声问。
en: “An island?” cried Pencroft.

zh: “是达抱岛。”
en: “Tabor Island.”

zh: “是重要的岛吗？”
en: “An important island?”

zh: “不，是太平洋里的一座荒岛，可能至今都没有人去过。”
en: “No, an islet lost in the Pacific, and which perhaps has never been visited.”

zh: “那我们就去吧。”潘克洛夫说。
en: “Well, we will visit it,” said Pencroft.

zh: “我们？”
en: “We?”

zh: “是的，上尉。我们可以造一艘甲板船，我来负责驾驶。我们离这个达抱岛有多远？”
en: “Yes, captain.We will build a decked boat, and I will undertake to steer her.At what distance are we from this Tabor Island?”

zh: “它在东北方向约150英里处。”哈丁回答说。
en: “About a hundred and fifty miles to the northeast,” replied Harding.

zh: “150英里！能有多远？”潘克洛夫说，“只要顺风，我们在48小时内就能看到它！”
en: “A hundred and fifty miles!And what’s that?” returned Pencroft.“In forty-eight hours, with a good wind, we should sight it!”

zh: 得到这样的回应之后，大伙决定赶紧造一艘船，等到将近十月份天气转好的时候启程。
en: And, on this reply, it was decided that a vessel should be constructed in time to be launched towards the month of next October, on the return of the fine season.

zh: 第十章
en: Chapter 10

zh: 只要潘克洛夫头脑中有个计划，他就心神不宁，直到计划被执行。现在他想去达抱岛，不过一艘大小合适的船对于这次航行是必需的，所以他决心造一艘。
en: When Pencroft had once got a plan in his head, he had no peace till it was executed.Now he wished to visit Tabor Island, and as a boat of a certain size was necessary for this voyage, he determined to build one.

zh: 他应该用哪种木材呢？榆树还是枞树？这两种木材岛上都长了很多。不过他们最终决定采用枞树，这样比较省事，而且这种树的防水功能也不比榆树差。
en: What wood should he employ?Elm or fir, both of which abounded in the island?They decided for the fir, as being easy to work, but which stands water as well as the elm.

zh: 细节都已经商定好了，由于还有六个月的时间天气才会转好，所以大家决定只留赛勒斯·哈丁和潘克洛夫单独造船。吉丁·史佩莱和赫伯特则继续打猎，纳布和他的助理贾普仍要留下来干交代给他们的家务活。
en: These details settled, it was agreed that since the fine season would not return before six months, Cyrus Harding and Pencroft should work alone at the boat.Gideon Spilett and Herbert were to continue to hunt, and neither Neb nor Master Jup, his assistant, were to leave the domestic duties which had devolved upon them.

zh: 树木很快就选好了，他们把树砍下来，去掉树枝，然后锯成板子，就像锯木工人能做出来的一样。一个星期过后，“石窟”和峭壁之间一块凹陷的地方上就准备好了一个造船所，还有一条长达35英尺的龙骨躺在沙子上，它的末端装上了船尾材，而前端则放上了船首材。
en: Directly the trees were chosen, they were felled, stripped of their branches, and sawn into planks as well as sawyers would have been able to do it.A week after, in the recess between the Chimneys and the cliff, a dockyard was prepared, and a keel five-and-thirty feet long, furnished with a stern-post at the stern and a stem at the bows, lay along the sand.

zh: 赛勒斯·哈丁在进行这项新任务的时候，并没有盲目行事。他对造船的了解几乎不比其他事情差，况且他还先在纸上绘制好了船的模型。而且，他还有潘克洛夫的得力协助。潘克洛夫在布鲁克林的造船所干过好几年，有造船的实践经验。经过仔细估算以及深思熟虑之后，他们才把木板加在了龙骨上。
en: Cyrus Harding was not working in the dark at this new trade.He knew as much about ship-building as about nearly everything else, and he had at first drawn the model of his ship on paper.Besides, he was ably seconded by Pencroft, who, having worked for several years in a dockyard in Brooklyn, knew the practical part of the trade.It was not until after careful calculation and deep thought that the timbers were laid on the keel.

zh: 潘克洛夫急切地想赶紧开始他新的大业，这种心情可以理解，他一分钟也不愿意离开他的工作。
en: Pencroft, as may be believed, was all eagerness to carry out his new enterprise, and would not leave his work for an instant.

zh: 有一件事竟然令他离开了造船所，这可是相当大的面子，不过只有一天而已。就是4月15日第二次麦收的那天。这次麦收和上次一样成功，收到的麦子和预期的数量一样。
en: A single thing had the honor of drawing him, but for one day only, from his dockyard.This was the second wheat-harvest, which was gathered in on the 15th of April.It was as much a success as the first, and yielded the number of grains which had been predicted.

zh: “五蒲式耳，上尉。”潘克洛夫说，他已经认真地量过了他的宝贝。
en: “Five bushels, captain,” said Pencroft, alter having scrupulously measured his treasure.

zh: “五蒲式耳，”工程师回应道，“每蒲式耳有13万粒，那我们总共就有65万粒了。”
en: “Five bushels,” replied the engineer; “and a hundred and thirty thousand grains a bushel will make six hundred and fifty thousand grains.”

zh: “那我们这次可以全部种上，”水手说，“只要留一点下来就行。”
en: “Well, we will sow them all this time,” said the sailor, “except a little in reserve.”

zh: “对，潘克洛夫，如果下一次也能按这个比例产出，那我们就能得到四千蒲式耳了。”
en: “Yes, Pencroft, and if the next crop gives a proportionate yield, we shall have four thousand bushels.”

zh: “那到时候我们能吃面包吗？”
en: “And shall we eat bread?”

zh: “我们能吃上面包。”
en: “We shall eat bread.”

zh: “不过我们得先弄台磨粉机。”
en: “But we must have a mill.

zh: “我们可以自己造一台。”
en: “We will make one.”

zh: 第三块麦田比前两块大多了，小心翼翼地把地辟好之后，他们就撒上了这些宝贵的种子。一切都完成后，潘克洛夫就回到原来的工作中。
en: The third corn-field was very much larger than the two first, and the soil, prepared with extreme care, received the precious seed.That done, Pencroft returned to his work.

zh: 也就是在这段时间，史佩莱和赫伯特在周围打猎，他们冒险深入到远西森林的未知区域，枪里面都装好了子弹，以防不测。这是一片长满参天大树的广阔丛林，树木都挤在一起，就好像迫切需要空间一样。要在如此茂密的树林里探索是极其困难的，记者没带袖珍指南针绝不冒险，因为这里的树叶都很浓密，几乎透不进阳光，顺着原路返回也很困难。在这样没有足够空间移动的地方，当然就更难见到猎物了，不过，四月下半月的时候，他们还是打着了两三只大个的草食动物。居民们在湖的北面就已经见过这种动物了，它们就是考拉熊，这些动物蠢到极点，藏身在如此茂密的枝叶之中，竟会被人射死。居民们把熊皮带回了花岗石宫，用硫酸经过一种鞣制工序后，熊皮就可以使用了。
