zh: “我是要解释，”赛勒斯·哈丁回答道，“或者可以说，我要把尼摩船长在弥留之际和我单独谈了几分钟时所解释的话告诉你们。”
en: “I will do so,” replied Cyrus Harding, “or rather I will simply afford you the explanation which, during our few minutes of private conversation, was given me by Captain Nemo.”

zh: “尼摩船长！”移民们喊道。
en: “Captain Nemo!” exclaimed the colonists.

zh: “是的，这是他临死前提供给我们的最后一次服务！”
en: “Yes, and it was the last service he desired to render us before his death!”

zh: “最后一次服务！”潘克洛夫叫道，“最后一次服务！你们将来会看到，虽然他已经去世了，他还会为我们提供其他服务的！”
en: “The last service!” exclaimed Pencroft, “the last service!You will see that though he is dead he will render us others yet!”

zh: “但是船长说了些什么呢？”通讯记者问道。
en: “But what did the captain say?” inquired the reporter.

zh: “我正要告诉你们，我的朋友们，”工程师说，“林肯岛和太平洋里其他的岛屿不同，尼摩船长告诉我，事实上林肯岛的根基迟早是要被颠覆的。”
en: “I will tell you, my friends,” said the engineer.“Lincoln Island does not resemble the other islands of the Pacific, and a fact of which Captain Nemo has made me cognizant must sooner or later bring about the subversion of its foundation.”

zh: “胡说！林肯岛不会的！”潘克洛夫喊道。虽然他很尊敬赛勒斯·哈丁，但他忍不住做了一个不相信的手势。
en: “Nonsense!Lincoln Island, it can’t be!” cried Pencroft, who, in spite of the respect he felt for Cyrus Harding, could not prevent a gesture of incredulity.

zh: “听着，潘克洛夫，”工程师接着说，“我要把尼摩船长告诉我的话告诉你们。在昨天检查了‘达卡洞’之后，我已经证实了他说的一切。
en: “Listen, Pencroft,” resumed the engineer, “I will tell you what Captain Nemo communicated to me, and which I myself confirmed yesterday, during the exploration of Dakkar Grotto.

zh: “这个洞窟在岛下一直延伸到火山底下，火山的中央管道和洞窟之间仅有一墙之隔。现在这面墙上有许多裂缝，现在缝隙里已经冒出来火山内部发出来的硫磺气体了。”
en: “This cavern stretches under the island as far as the volcano, and is only separated from its central shaft by the wall which terminates it.Now, this wall is seamed with fissures and clefts which already allow the sulphurous gases generated in the interior of the volcano to escape.”

zh: “什么？”潘克洛夫突然皱起眉头说。
en: “Well?” said Pencroft, his brow suddenly contracting.

zh: “嗯，后来，我发现这些裂缝由于内部的压力变宽了，玄武岩的墙壁逐渐裂开，迟早会裂出一条大口子，连通火山管道和充满海水的洞窟。”
en: “Well, then, I saw that these fissures widen under the internal pressure from within, that the wall of basalt is gradually giving way and that after a longer or shorter period it will afford a passage to the waters of the lake which fill the cavern.”

zh: “好啊！”潘克洛夫高兴地答道，“海水将会扑灭火山，就什么事也没有啦！”
en: “Good!” replied Pencroft, with an attempt at pleasantry.“The sea will extinguish the volcano, and there will be an end of the matter!”

zh: “不是那样的！”赛勒斯·哈丁说，“等到海水灌进洞窟，通过中央管道进入岛内部沸腾的岩浆里去的那一天，林肯岛就要被炸到天上去了——如果地中海的海水灌进埃得纳火山中去，西西里岛也会这样的。”
en: “Not so!” said Cyrus Harding, “should a day arrive when the sea, rushing through the wall of the cavern, penetrates by the central shaft into the interior of the island to the boiling lava, Lincoln Island will that day be blown into the air—just as would happen to the island of Sicily were the Mediterranean to precipitate itself into Mount Etna.”

zh: 听了工程师说的这番意义重大的话，移民们都不作声了。现在他们明白面临的危险了。
en: The colonists made no answer to these significant words of the engineer.They now understood the danger by which they were menaced.

zh: 应该补充一点，赛勒斯·哈丁丝毫没有夸大值得他们担忧的危险。火山几乎都在海或湖的岸边，所以很多人想当然以为只要开出一条通道把水灌进火山，就可以把火山熄灭。但是他们却不知道这样会引发地球局部爆炸的危险，就如锅炉里的气体遇到高温会突然膨胀一样。火山里的温度可能达到几千度，灌进去的水会立刻转化成气体，突然产生一种不可阻挡的能量。
en: It may be added that Cyrus Harding had in no way exaggerated the danger to be apprehended.Many persons have formed an idea that it would be possible to extinguish volcanoes, which are almost always situated on the shores of a sea or lake, by opening a passage for the admission of the water.But they are not aware that this would be to incur the risk of blowing up a portion of the globe, like a boiler whose steam is suddenly expanded by intense heat.The water, rushing into a cavity whose temperature might be estimated at thousands of degrees, would be converted into steam with a sudden energy which no enclosure could resist.

zh: 因此，毫无疑问，可怕的震动在一步步向林肯岛逼近，“达卡洞”的石墙能保持多久，林肯岛就能存在多久。这不是几个月，也不是几个星期的问题，而是几天，甚至可能是几个小时的问题。
en: It was not therefore doubtful that the island, menaced by a frightful and approaching convulsion, would endure only so long as the wall of Dakkar Grotto itself should endure.It was not even a question of months, nor of weeks, but of days; it might be of hours.

zh: 移民们的第一反应是心情极其悲痛。他们并没有过多考虑自己面临的危险，他们痛心的是长期庇护他们的岛屿就要毁灭了。他们开拓了这个荒岛，他们爱这个岛，想使它变得繁荣。但是他们这么多的努力都白费了，这么多劳动也白费了。
en: The first sentiment which the colonists felt was that of profound sorrow.They thought not so much of the peril which menaced themselves personally, but of the destruction of the island which had sheltered them, which they had cultivated, which they loved so well, and had hoped to render so flourishing.So much effort ineffectually expended, so much labor lost.

zh: 一大颗眼泪从潘克洛夫的脸上滑落，他也没有刻意掩饰。
en: Pencroft could not prevent a large tear from rolling down his cheek, nor did he attempt to conceal it.

zh: 现在讨论进一步展开。移民们讨论了对他们有利的机会。最终大家一致同意一个小时也不要浪费，造船工作要全力以赴，加快进行，这是林肯岛移民获得安全的唯一出路。
en: Some further conversation now took place.The chances yet in favor of the colonists were discussed; but finally it was agreed that there was not an hour to be lost, that the building and fitting of the vessel should be pushed forward with their utmost energy, and that this was the sole chance of safety for the inhabitants of Lincoln Island.

zh: 因此，每个人都开始参加到造船工作中去。现在播种、收割、打猎和增加花岗石宫的储备还有什么用呢？不管他们的航程要持续多久，仓库和外面储存的物资都足以支撑他们的旅程。但是紧急的是，他们必须先把船造好，以保证不可避免的灾难到来之前船可以供他们使用。
en: All hands, therefore, set to work on the vessel.What could it avail to sow, to reap, to hunt, to increase the stores of Granite House?The contents of the storehouse and outbuildings contained more than sufficient to provide the ship for a voyage, however long might be its duration.But it was imperative that the ship should be ready to receive them before the inevitable catastrophe should arrive.

zh: 他们以火一般的热情进行着工作。到1月23日的时候，船上的甲板已经铺好了一半。到目前为止，火山顶峰上并没有发生变化。火山口喷出来水蒸气和烟雾，还夹杂着火焰和白热的岩石。可是在23日的夜里，岩浆流到了火山第一层的表面，覆盖在另一个火山锥上的帽状火山锥不见了。可怕的响声传来。起初移民们以为岛被炸开了，都从花岗石宫里冲了出来。
en: Their labors were now carried on with feverish ardor.By the 23rd of January the vessel was half-decked over.Up to this time no change had taken place on the summit of the volcano.Vapor and smoke mingled with flames and incandescent stones were thrown up from the crater.But during the night of the 23rd, in consequence of the lava attaining the level of the first stratum of the volcano, the hat-shaped cone which formed over the latter disappeared.A frightful sound was heard.The colonists at first thought the island was rent asunder, and rushed out of Granite House.

zh: 这时候大概是凌晨两点钟。
en: This occurred about two o’clock in the morning.

zh: 天空好像着了火一样。原来是山顶的火山锥被抛到岛上，震动了岛的地基。这个火山锥是由大堆的大堆的岩石组成，高达一千英尺，重达亿万磅。幸运的是，由于这个火山锥向北倾斜，最终落在火山和大海之间的沙子和凝灰岩的平地上了。火山口因此扩大，喷向天空的火焰更加闪耀，反射出来的光线把天空照得通红。同时，一股岩浆流从新的山顶倾泻而下，像一条长长的飞瀑，又像花瓶里水满而溢一样。上千条火舌沿着火山坡滑下。
en: The sky appeared on fire.The superior cone, a mass of rock a thousand feet in height, and weighing thousands of millions of pounds, had been thrown down upon the island, making it tremble to its foundation.Fortunately, this cone inclined to the north, and had fallen upon the plain of sand and tufa stretching between the volcano and the sea.The aperture of the crater being thus enlarged projected towards the sky a glare so intense that by the simple effect of reflection the atmosphere appeared red-hot.At the same time a torrent of lava, bursting from the new summit, poured out in long cascades, like water escaping from a vase too full, and a thousand tongues of fire crept over the sides of the volcano.

zh: “畜栏！畜栏！”艾尔顿喊道。
en: “The corral! the corral!” exclaimed Ayrton.

zh: 的确，岩浆正朝着畜栏方向流。由于新的火山口面向东方，因此岛上土地肥沃的地区、红河的源头和啄木鸟林很快就要毁灭了。
en: It was, in fact, towards the corral that the lava was rushing as the new crater faced the east, and consequently the fertile portions of the island, the springs of Red Creek and Jacamar Wood, were menaced with instant destruction.

zh: 听到艾尔顿的叫声后，移民们匆忙向野驴棚跑去。马车马上就套好了。所有人想法都一致，那就是赶快到畜栏把那里的牲口放出来。
en: At Ayrton’s cry the colonists rushed to the onagers’ stables.The cart was at once harnessed.All were possessed by the same thought—to hasten to the corral and set at liberty the animals it enclosed.

zh: 将近凌晨三点钟的时候，他们到达了畜栏。摩弗仑羊和山羊叫了起来，这说明它们十分恐惧。一股燃烧的物质和熔化的矿石从山的一侧流到草场上，一直流到栅栏边上。艾尔顿很快打开畜栏的大门，恐惧的牲口向四面八方逃跑。
en: Before three in the morning they arrived at the corral.The cries of the terrified musmons and goats indicated the alarm which possessed them.Already a torrent of burning matter and liquefied minerals fell from the side of the mountain upon the meadows as far as the side of the palisade.The gate was burst open by Ayrton, and the animals, bewildered with terror, fled in all directions.

zh: 一个小时后，沸腾的岩浆流满了畜栏，从畜栏流过的小河的河水化成了一片蒸汽，房子像干草一样烧成灰烬，甚至连栅栏的木桩也一根没剩，完全辨认不出这里曾经有畜栏。
en: An hour afterwards the boiling lava filled the corral, converting into vapor the water of the little rivulet which ran through it, burning up the house like dry grass, and leaving not even a post of the palisade to mark the spot where the corral once stood.

zh: 和这种灾难斗争可以说是荒唐，甚至可以说是发疯。面对大自然的强烈震动，人类无能为力。
en: To contend against this disaster would have been folly—nay, madness.In presence of Nature’s grand convulsions man is powerless.

zh: 现在天已经亮了，已经是1月24日。赛勒斯·哈丁和他的伙伴们想在回花岗石宫之前，确定岩浆的大致流向。地势从富兰克林山起向东海岸渐渐倾斜。让人担心的是，虽然有浓密的啄木鸟林阻隔，岩浆流很可能还是要流到眺望岗的高地上。
en: It was now daylight—the 24th of January.Cyrus Harding and his companions, before returning to Granite House, desired to ascertain the probable direction this inundation of lava was about to take.The soil sloped gradually from Mount Franklin to the east coast, and it was to be feared that, in spite of the thick Jacamar Wood, the torrent would reach the plateau of Prospect Heights.

zh: “湖会保护我们的。”吉迪恩·史佩莱说。
en: “The lake will cover us,” said Gideon Spilett.

zh: “但愿如此！”赛勒斯·哈丁只回答了这么一句。
en: “I hope so!” was Cyrus Harding’s only reply.

zh: 移民们想到富兰克林山较高的火山锥坠落的那片平原上去，但是岩浆挡住了他们的去路。一股岩浆顺着红河河谷流下来，一股顺着瀑布河河谷流下来。岩浆所到之处，河水都蒸发了。要横跨岩浆流是不可能的，相反，移民们面对岩浆流只能往后退。火山没有了顶以后，已经辨认不出原来的样子，代替古代火山口的是一片像平整的桌面一样的东西。南边和东边各有一个喷口，岩浆不断地从里面喷泻出来，形成两股清晰的洪流。新的火山口上冒起的烟雾混在空气里，笼罩着整个岛屿。轰隆隆的雷声与火山发出的轰隆声交织在一起，几乎无法分辨。火山口喷出燃烧的石块，直射到一千多英尺的高空，然后像炮弹一样在空气中爆炸。一道道闪电竞相与火山喷发比试。
en: The colonists were desirous of reaching the plain upon which the superior cone of Mount Franklin had fallen, but the lava arrested their progress.It had followed, on one side, the valley of Red Creek, and on the other that of Falls River, evaporating those watercourses in its passage.There was no possibility of crossing the torrent of lava; on the contrary, the colonists were obliged to retreat before it.The volcano, without its crown, was no longer recognizable, terminated as it was by a sort of flat table which replaced the ancient crater.From two openings in its southern and eastern sides an unceasing flow of lava poured forth, thus forming two distinct streams.Above the new crater a cloud of smoke and ashes, mingled with those of the atmosphere, massed over the island.Loud peals of thunder broke, and could scarcely be distinguished from the rumblings of the mountain, whose mouth vomited forth ignited rocks, which, hurled to more than a thousand feet, burst in the air like shells.Flashes of lightning rivaled in intensity the volcano’s eruption.

zh: 将近早上七点钟的时候，移民们的阵地再也坚守不住了，于是他们只得藏身到啄木鸟林的边缘地带。抛射下来的东西下雨似的落在他们周围，甚至从红河河床流下来的岩浆也要切断去畜栏的路了。最近的一排树着火了，树汁突然转化成蒸汽开始爆炸，发出响亮的声音。其他不太潮湿的树木，在岩浆流里安然矗立。
en: Towards seven in the morning the position was no longer tenable by the colonists, who accordingly took shelter in the borders of Jacamar Wood.Not only did the projectiles begin to rain around them, but the lava, overflowing the bed of Red Creek, threatened to cut off the road to the corral.The nearest rows of trees caught fire, and their sap, suddenly transformed into vapor, caused them to explode with loud reports, while others, less moist, remained unhurt in the midst of the inundation.

zh: 移民们又走上了去畜栏的路。他们走得很慢，时不时回头看看。由于地面倾斜，岩浆很快地往东流，所以下层的岩浆刚刚凝固，就被上面的沸腾岩浆淹没了。
en: The colonists had again taken the road to the corral.They proceeded but slowly, frequently looking back; but, in consequence of the inclination of the soil, the lava gained rapidly in the east, and as its lower waves became solidified others, at boiling heat, covered them immediately.

zh: 这个时候，红河河谷的主要洪流越来越危险。这一片的森林着了火，滚滚浓烟在树上翻滚，树干已经被岩浆淹没。
en: Meanwhile, the principal stream of Red Creek Valley became more and more menacing.All this portion of the forest was on fare, and enormous wreaths of smoke rolled over the trees, whore trunks were already consumed by the lava.

zh: 移民们在距离红河河口半英里的湖边停下。现在是决定生死存亡的时候了。
en: The colonists halted near the lake, about half a mile from the mouth of Red Creek.A question of life or death was now to be decided.

zh: 赛勒斯·哈丁是习惯思考重要问题的，并且他也清楚，不管怎么样，大家听了真相后也能经受得住。于是他说道：
en: Cyrus Harding, accustomed to the consideration of important crises, and aware that he was addressing men capable of hearing the truth, whatever it might be, then said,—

zh: “要么湖水挡住岩浆前进，这样的话一部分岛屿就可以保留下来，不至于完全毁灭；要么岩浆流过远西森林，地上不留一草一木。如果这样的话，我们除了在这些光秃秃的石头上等着饿死别无它法。如果岛爆炸，我们的死期还可能提前。”
en: “Either the lake will arrest the progress of the lava, and a part of the island will be preserved from utter destruction, or the stream will overrun the forests of the Far West, and not a tree or plant will remain on the surface of the soil.We shall have no prospect but that of starvation upon these barren rocks—a death which will probably be anticipated by the explosion of the island.”

zh: “既然这样，”潘克洛夫抱着胳膊跺着脚说，“我们造船还有什么用呢？”
en: “In that case,” replied Pencroft, folding his arms and stamping his foot, “what’s the use of working any longer on the vessel?”

zh: “潘克洛夫，”赛勒斯·哈丁说，“我们一定要坚持到最后！”
en: “Pencroft,” answered Cyrus Harding, “we must do our duty to the last!”

zh: 这时候，岩浆流在吞没了一些珍贵的树后冲出了一条通道，一直到达湖的边缘。这一带地势较高，如果再高一些，也许就可以阻断岩浆流。
en: At this instant the river of lava, after having broken a passage through the noble trees it devoured in its course, reached the borders of the lake.At this point there was an elevation of the soil which, had it been greater, might have sufficed to arrest the torrent.

zh: “开始干吧！”赛勒斯·哈丁喊道。
en: “To work!” cried Cyrus Harding.

zh: 大家立刻领会了工程师的意思。他们可以截断洪流，让它流入湖里。
en: The engineer’s thought was at once understood. it might be possible to dam, as it were, the torrent, and thus compel it to pour itself into the lake.

zh: 移民们赶忙跑到造船所。他们拿回很多铲子、锄头和斧头，用泥土和倒下的树木在几个小时内成功筑起一道三英尺高、数百步长的堤坝。完工的时候，对他们来说，似乎感觉只干了几分钟。
en: The colonists hastened to the dockyard.They returned with shovels, picks, axes, and by means of banking the earth with the aid of fallen trees they succeeded in a few hours in raising an embankment three feet high and some hundreds of paces in length.It seemed to them, when they had finished, as if they had scarcely been working more than a few minutes.

zh: 堤坝完成得正是时候。岩浆不久就流到堤坝脚下了。岩浆流像河水漫过河岸般地肆意泛滥，威胁着这道能够阻挡它淹没整个远西森林的唯一屏障。但是堤坝很牢固，经过一段时间的僵持后，岩浆流流入了二十英尺下的格兰特湖。
en: It was not a moment too soon.The liquefied substances soon after reached the bottom of the barrier.The stream of lava swelled like a river about to overflow its banks, and threatened to demolish the sole obstacle which could prevent it from overrunning the whole Far West.But the dam held firm, and after a moment of terrible suspense the torrent precipitated itself into Grant Lake from a height of twenty feet.

zh: 移民们一动不动，也不作声，屏住呼吸看着双方交战。
en: The colonists, without moving or uttering a word, breathlessly regarded this strife of the two elements.

zh: 水与火的搏击是多么壮观啊！什么笔墨可以描绘出这一惊奇恐怖的场景呢？湖水在岩浆的作用下蒸发，嗞嗞作响。水蒸汽在空气中盘旋而上，升到一个无可测量的高度，好像一个大锅炉的阀门突然被打开了似的。但是，不管湖里的水有多少，最后还是要干枯的。因为已经没有水补充湖水了，同时无穷的岩浆夹带的白色物质却不断流到湖里。
en: What a spectacle was this conflict between water and fire!What pen could describe the marvelous horror of this scene—what pencil could depict it?The water hissed as it evaporated by contact with the boiling lava.The vapor whirled in the air to an immeasurable height, as if the valves of an immense boiler had been suddenly opened.But, however considerable might be the volume of water contained in the lake, it must eventually be absorbed, because it was not replenished, while the stream of lava, fed from an inexhaustible source, rolled on without ceasing new waves of incandescent matter.

zh: 第一股岩浆流流入湖中后立即凝固，继而很快堆积起来高出水面。新的岩浆又覆盖到堆积物的表面，依次化为岩石，但是一步步逼近湖中心。这种情况下就形成了一个突堤，要把湖逐渐填满。湖水不可能泛滥起来，因为它们遇到岩浆而蒸发，岩浆代替了它们的位置。刺耳的嗞嗞声到处作响，水汽被风吹走，像雨点般地落入大海。突堤越来越长，岩浆块一个个堆积起来。原来平静的湖水现在变成了一大堆冒着烟的岩石，好像是土地上升而形成的一大片浅滩。想象一下，如果湖水被飓风掀起时突然遇到霜冻而凝结，就可以知道三个小时后这股不可阻挡的岩浆流注入湖中是什么景象了。
en: The first waves of lava which fell in the lake immediately solidified and accumulated so as speedily to emerge from it.Upon their surface fell other waves, which in their turn became stone, but a step nearer the center of the lake.In this manner was formed a pier which threatened to gradually fill up the lake, which could not overflow, the water displaced by the lava being evaporated.The hissing of the water rent the air with a deafening sound, and the vapor, blown by the wind, fell in rain upon the sea.The pier became longer and longer, and the blocks of lava piled themselves one on another.Where formerly stretched the calm waters of the lake now appeared an enormous mass of smoking rocks, as if an upheaving of the soil had formed immense shoals.Imagine the waters of the lake aroused by a hurricane, then suddenly solidified by an intense frost, and some conception may be formed of the aspect of the lake three hours alter the eruption of this irresistible torrent of lava.

zh: 这一次，水要被火征服了。
en: This time water would be vanquished by fire.

zh: 无论如何，岩浆流向了格兰特湖，这对移民们是有利的。他们可以暂缓几天了。眺望岗的高地、花岗石宫和造船所暂时都保存下来了。现在必须利用这几天的时间为船铺上板子，仔细填补船缝，并让船下水。那时移民们就可以到船上避难了，等船下水以后再安装索具。如果爆炸发生，荒岛将被毁灭，那时在岸上也不安全。花岗石宫曾经是可靠的藏身之所，但是现在它的墙壁随时可能坍塌。
en: Nevertheless it was a fortunate circumstance for the colonists that the effusion of lava should have been in the direction of Lake Grant.They had before them some days’ respite.The plateau of Prospect Heights, Granite House, and the dockyard were for the moment preserved.And these few days it was necessary to employ in planking and carefully calking the vessel, and launching her.The colonists would then take refuge on board the vessel, content to rig her after she should be afloat on the waters.With the danger of an explosion which threatened to destroy the island there could be no security on shore.The walls of Granite House, once so sure a retreat, might at any moment fall in upon them.

zh: 在以后的六天里，从1月25日到1月30日，移民们在造船工作中，做了相当于二十个人的工作。他们几乎一刻也不让自己休息。火山口喷射出来的火光使他们得以夜以继日地工作。岩浆还在不断地流出，却少了许多。这是极其幸运的，因为格兰特湖几乎已经填满了，要是更多的岩浆流过来，不可避免地要流到眺望岗的高地上，然后再流到海滩上。
en: During the six following days, from the 25th to the 30th of January, the colonists accomplished as much of the construction of their vessel as twenty men could have done.They hardly allowed themselves a moment’s repose, and the glare of the flames which shot from the crater enabled them to work night and day.The flow of lava continued, but perhaps less abundantly.This was fortunate, for Lake Grant was almost entirely choked up, and if more lava should accumulate it would inevitably spread over the plateau of Prospect Heights, and thence upon the beach.

zh: 但是，虽然岛这边有一部分被保护，但是西边并不是这样。
en: But if the island was thus partially protected on this side, it was not so with the western part.

zh: 事实上，第二股岩浆流顺着瀑布河的河谷而流，这条河谷非常宽阔，两岸地势平坦，岩浆流经过这里没有遇到任何阻碍。沸腾的岩浆扩散到远西森林。在这个季节，树木都被酷热的气候烤干了。树木立刻着了火，火焰在树干间和高处的树枝间蔓延，高处的树枝交叉在一起，大火蔓延得更加迅速。树梢上火焰的蔓延速度似乎比树根处岩浆的流动速度还要快。
en: In fact, the second stream of lava, which had followed the valley of Falls River, a valley of great extent, the land on both sides of the creek being flat, met with no obstacle.The burning liquid had then spread through the forest of the Far West.At this period of the year, when the trees were dried up by a tropical heat, the forest caught fire instantaneously, in such a manner that the conflagration extended itself both by the trunks of the trees and by their higher branches, whose interlacement favored its progress.It even appeared that the current of flame spread more rapidly among the summits of the trees than the current of lava at their bases.

zh: 美洲豹、野猪、水豚、考拉和各种野生动物都惊慌失措，纷纷往慈悲河岸边和通向气球港的路上的沼泽奔逃。移民们正忙着工作，甚至连最凶猛的野兽也无暇顾忌。他们离开了花岗石宫，也不在“石窟”里居住了，只在慈悲河河口处搭了一个帐篷露宿。
en: Thus it happened that the wild animals, jaguars, wild boars, capybaras, koalas, and game of every kind, mad with terror, had fled to the banks of the Mercy and to the Tadorn Marsh, beyond the road to Port Balloon.But the colonists were too much occupied with their task to pay any attention to even the most formidable of these animals.They had abandoned Granite House, and would not even take shelter at the Chimneys, but encamped under a tent, near the mouth of the Mercy.

zh: 赛勒斯·哈丁和吉迪恩·史佩莱每天都登上眺望岗的高地。有时候赫伯特跟着他们，但潘克洛夫从来不去，他不忍心看到现在岛上彻底遭到毁灭的悲惨景象。
en: Each day Cyrus Harding and Gideon Spilett ascended the plateau of Prospect Heights.Sometimes Herbert accompanied them, but never Pencroft, who could not bear to look upon the prospect of the island now so utterly devastated.

zh: 这的确是令人痛心的景象。这个岛上的森林地带现在全都光秃了。只有盘蛇半岛的尽头还残留着一丛绿树。到处是奇形怪状的树桩，个个被熏得漆黑，连树枝也没有了。这一带被毁坏的森林甚至比沼泽地还要荒凉。岩浆流流得到处都是。原来迷人的青翠草原现在变成了一大片荒凉的火山凝灰岩。瀑布河和慈悲河的河谷里，再没有一滴水流入大海了。要是格兰特湖完全干涸的话，移民们就没有办法解决饮水问题了。南边一角的湖水没有被岩浆侵占，这里是岛上仅有的淡水源了。西北方屹立着轮廓清晰的崎岖的火山坡，像一只巨爪在荒岛上盘旋。这是多么凄惨而可怕的景象啊！对移民们来说，又是多么痛心啊！过去有肥沃的土地，覆盖着森林，有水源灌溉，在移民们的辛勤劳动下还收获了丰富的物产，现在变成了荒山，他们除了储备的粮食外，连维持生活的必需品都没有了。
en: It was, in truth, a heart-rending spectacle.All the wooded part of the island was now completely bare.One single clump of green trees raised their heads at the extremity of Serpentine Peninsula.Here and there were a few grotesque blackened and branchless stumps.The side of the devastated forest was even more barren than Tadorn Marsh.The eruption of lava had been complete.Where formerly sprang up that charming verdure, the soil was now nothing but a savage mass of volcanic tufa.In the valleys of the Falls and Mercy rivers no drop of water now flowed towards the sea, and should Lake Grant be entirely dried up, the colonists would have no means of quenching their thirst.But, fortunately the lava had spared the southern corner of the lake, containing all that remained of the drinking water of the island.Towards the northwest stood out the rugged and well-defined outlines of the sides of the volcano, like a gigantic claw hovering over the island.What a sad and fearful sight, and how painful to the colonists, who, from a fertile domain covered with forests, irrigated by watercourses, and enriched by the produce of their toils, found themselves, as it were, transported to a desolate rock, upon which, but for their reserves of provisions, they could not even gather the means of subsistence!

zh: “这足以让人心碎了！”有一天吉迪恩·史佩莱说。
en: “It is enough to break one’s heart!” said Gideon Spilett, one day.

zh: “是的，史佩莱，”工程师说，“但愿上帝给我们时间来完成这艘船，现在它是我们唯一的避难所了！”
en: “Yes, Spilett,” answered the engineer.“May God grant us the time to complete this vessel, now our sole refuge!”

zh: “赛勒斯，你难道不觉得火山爆发得不是那么猛烈了吗？如果我没有搞错的话，火山依然在喷岩浆，但是喷得比以前少多了。”
en: “Do not you think, Cyrus, that the violence of the eruption has somewhat lessened?The volcano still vomits forth lava, but somewhat less abundantly, if I mistake not.”

zh: “这倒关系不大，”赛勒斯·哈丁回答说，“火还在山内部燃烧呢，海水随时可能灌进去。我们就好像一群乘客，船失了火，但没办法扑灭，我们又知道火迟早要烧到火药库里去。干吧，史佩莱，干吧，我们一个小时也不能浪费！”
en: “It matters little,” answered Cyrus Harding.“The fire is still burning in the interior of the mountain, and the sea may break in at any moment.We are in the condition of passengers whose ship is devoured by a conflagration which they cannot extinguish, and who know that sooner or later the flames must reach the powder-magazine.To work, Spilett, to work, and let us not lose an hour!”

zh: 又过了八天，也就是直到2月7日，岩浆还在不断溢出，火山爆发仍然维持在原来的水平上。赛勒斯·哈丁担心岩浆会泛滥到海边，如果那样的话，造船所就在劫难逃了。而且，此时移民们感觉岛屿开始颤动，这使他们倍感恐惧。
en: During eight days more, that is to say until the 7th of February, the lava continued to flow, but the eruption was confined within the previous limits.Cyrus Harding feared above all lest the liquefied matter should overflow the shore, for in that event the dockyard could not escape.Moreover, about this time the colonists felt in the frame of the island vibrations which alarmed them to the highest degree.

zh: 这一天是2月20日。还要一个月船才能下水。这个岛能坚持到那时吗？潘克洛夫和赛勒斯·哈丁打算船身完工后就让船立刻下水。甲板、干舷、内部的木制品和索具都可以将来再完成。主要是要让移民们在岛外有一个可靠的避难所。也许把船带到气球港去会好一些，也就是说，尽量离爆炸中心远一些，因为慈悲河口在岛和花岗石墙壁之间，一旦发生巨变，他们的船停在那儿是有被砸碎的危险的。因此航海家们的所有努力集中在完成船身的工作上。
en: It was the 20th of February.Yet another month must elapse before the vessel would be ready for sea.Would the island hold together till then?The intention of Pencroft and Cyrus Harding was to launch the vessel as soon as the hull should be complete.The deck, the upperworks, the interior woodwork and the rigging might be finished afterwards, but the essential point was that the colonists should have an assured refuge away from the island.Perhaps it might be even better to conduct the vessel to Port Balloon, that is to say, as far as possible from the center of eruption, for at the mouth of the Mercy, between the islet and the wall of granite, it would run the risk of being crushed in the event of any convulsion.All the exertions of the voyagers were therefore concentrated upon the completion of the hull.

zh: 到了3月3日，预计再有十天就可以让船下水了。
en: Thus the 3rd of March arrived, and they might calculate upon launching the vessel in ten days.

zh: 移民们心中又重拾了希望，他们在林肯岛上的第四个年头，经受起无数考验。就连一直为自己的领地遭到破坏和毁灭而闷闷不乐的潘克洛夫心情也好了不少。的确，他的希望是集中在船上的。
en: Hope revived in the hearts of the colonists, who had, in this fourth year of their sojourn on Lincoln island, suffered so many trials.Even Pencroft lost in some measure the somber taciturnity occasioned by the devastation and ruin of his domain.His hopes, it is true, were concentrated upon his vessel.

zh: “我们要完成它，”他对工程师说，“我们要完成它，队长，现在也正是时候，现在季节正在变换，快到秋分了。如果有必要的话，我们就要把船停在达抱岛过冬。还是先想想林肯岛，再考虑达抱岛吧。哎，真不幸啊！谁想得到会发生这样的事呢？”
en: “We shall finish it,” he said to the engineer, “we shall finish it, captain, and it is time, for the season is advancing and the equinox will soon be here.Well, if necessary, we must put in to Tabor island to spend the winter.But think of Tabor island after Lincoln Island.Ah, how unfortunate!Who could have believed it possible?”

zh: “我们继续干吧。”工程师一如既往地回答。
en: “Let us get on,” was the engineer’s invariable reply.

zh: 于是他们继续工作，分秒必争。
en: And they worked away without losing a moment.

zh: “船长，”过了几天纳布问道，“您觉得要是尼摩船长还活着，这一切还会发生吗？”
en: “Master,” asked Neb, a few days later, “do you think all this could have happened if Captain Nemo had been still alive?”

zh: “当然会，纳布。”赛勒斯·哈丁回答道。
en: “Certainly, Neb,” answered Cyrus Harding.

zh: “我本人可不这么看！”潘克洛夫小声对纳布说。
en: “I, for one, don’t believe it!” whispered Pencroft to Neb.

zh: “我也是！”纳布严肃地说。
en: “Nor I!” answered Neb seriously.

zh: 三月份的第一个星期，情况变得更危险了。上万条玻璃丝似的岩浆，下雨似的落到岛上。火山口的岩浆又开始沸腾，流到火山的后面。岩浆流沿着已经凝固了的凝灰岩表面流去，把第一次火山爆发后残存下来的几株干枯的树干都毁坏了。这次，岩浆流向格兰特湖的西南岸流过来，一直流过甘油河，侵入眺望岗的高地。这对移民们的事业来说是最后一次打击，这打击是相当可怕的。磨坊、内院的建筑和马厩都被毁坏了。受到惊吓的家禽向四面八方乱逃。托普和贾普表现出极度恐惧的样子，似乎它们的直觉警告它们灾难就要到来了。第一次爆发的时候，岛上就有很多动物死了。幸存下来的动物找不到避难之地，只能到沼泽地上，只有少数动物逃到眺望岗的高地上，把这里当收容所。但现在也没有他们的容身之处了，岩浆流沿着花岗石墙的边缘往海滩倾泄，形成一道火瀑。这壮观的景象是不能用言语形容的。在夜里，只能把它比作岩浆形成的尼亚加拉大瀑布，上面是水蒸汽，下面是沸腾的物质。
en: During the first week of March appearances again became menacing.Thousands of threads like glass, formed of fluid lava, fell like rain upon the island.The crater was again boiling with lava which overflowed the back of the volcano.The torrent flowed along the surface of the hardened tufa, and destroyed the few meager skeletons of trees which had withstood the first eruption.The stream, flowing this time towards the southwest shore of Lake Grant, stretched beyond Creek Glycerine, and invaded the plateau of Prospect Heights.This last blow to the work of the colonists was terrible.The mill, the buildings of the inner court, the stables, were all destroyed.The affrighted poultry fled in all directions.Top and Jup showed signs of the greatest alarm, as if their instinct warned them of an impending catastrophe.A large number of the animals of the island had perished in the first eruption.Those which survived found no refuge but Tadorn Marsh, save a few to which the plateau of Prospect Heights afforded asylum.But even this last retreat was now closed to them, and the lava-torrent, flowing over the edge of the granite wall, began to pour down upon the beach its cataracts of fire.The sublime horror of this spectacle passed all description.During the night it could only be compared to a Niagara of molten fluid, with its incandescent vapors above and its boiling masses below.

zh: 移民们被赶到最后的堡垒里去了。虽然船上面的缝隙还没有填好，但他们决定让船立即下水。
en: The colonists were driven to their last entrenchment, and although the upper seams of the vessel were not yet calked, they decided to launch her at once.

zh: 潘克洛夫和艾尔顿做好了下水所需的必要准备，新船下水就定在第二天，也就是3月9日的早晨。
en: Pencroft and Ayrton therefore set about the necessary preparations for the launching, which was to take place the morning of the next day, the 9th of March.

zh: 但是3月8日夜晚，一股水蒸汽从火山口喷出来，像一根巨大的柱子一样，还发出了可怕的爆炸声，一直升到三千英尺以上的高空。“达卡洞”的墙壁在气体的压力下崩塌了，海水通过中央管道灌进火坑，立即化成水蒸汽。但是火山口不足以让水蒸汽完全排出。爆炸声震天动地，就是在一百英里以外也能听到。山上的碎岩石块飞进太平洋，几分钟后海水就漫过原来林肯岛所在的地方了。
en: But during the night of the 8th an enormous column of vapor escaping from the crater rose with frightful explosions to a height of more than three thousand feet.The wall of Dakkar Grotto had evidently given way under the pressure of gases, and the sea, rushing through the central shalt into the igneous gulf, was at once converted into vapor.But the crater could not afford a sufficient outlet for this vapor.An explosion, which might have been heard at a distance of a hundred miles, shook the air.Fragments of mountains fell into the Pacific, and, in a few minutes, the ocean rolled over the spot where Lincoln island once stood.

zh: 第二十章
en: Chapter 20

zh: 一块孤立的石头，30英尺长，20英尺宽，几乎只高出水平面10英尺，这是唯一没有被太平洋的波涛淹没的地方。
en: An isolated rock, thirty feet in length, twenty in breadth, scarcely ten from the water’s edge, such was the only solid point which the waves of the Pacific had not engulfed.

zh: 这就是花岗石宫仅存的一点！石墙匐然倒塌，砸成碎块，几块大一点的石头一个个堆叠起来，形成了这块陆地。所有周围的一切都消失在海洋深处：被炸成两半的富兰克林山的较低的火山锥、鲨鱼湾的熔岩口、眺望岗的高地、安全岛、气球港的花岗石、“达卡洞”的玄武岩，还有远离爆炸中心的狭长的盘蛇半岛。林肯岛现在能看到的只剩下这条狭长的岩石，现在这块岩石成了六个移民和托普的避难所。
en: It was all that remained of the structure of Granite House!The wall had fallen headlong and been then shattered to fragments, and a few of the rocks of the large room were piled one above another to form this point.All around had disappeared in the abyss; the inferior cone of Mount Franklin, rent asunder by the explosion; the lava jaws of Shark Gulf, the plateau of Prospect Heights, Safety Islet, the granite rocks of Port Balloon, the basalts of Dakkar Grotto, the long Serpentine Peninsula, so distant nevertheless from the center of the eruption.All that could now be seen of Lincoln Island was the narrow rock which now served as a refuge to the six colonists and their dog Top.

zh: 动物们都在这场灾难中丧生了。鸟和岛上的几种代表性动物要么被压死，要么被淹死，不幸的贾普也被压在地下了。
en: The animals had also perished in the catastrophe; the birds, as well as those representing the fauna of the island—all either crushed or drowned, and the unfortunate Jup himself had, alas! found his death in some crevice of the soil.

zh: 赛勒斯·哈丁、吉迪恩·史佩莱、赫伯特、潘克洛夫、纳布和艾尔顿幸存了下来，因为他们当时聚集在帐篷底下，当岛被炸得粉碎，碎块像雨点似的四处落下的时候，他们被抛到了海里。
en: If Cyrus Harding, Gideon Spilett, Herbert, Pencroft, Neb, and Ayrton had survived, it was because, assembled under their tent, they had been hurled into the sea at the instant when the fragments of the island rained down on every side.

zh: 他们浮到水面上时，只能看到半锚链外有一堆石头，他们就朝着石头游过来，在上面找到立足之地。
en: When they reached the surface they could only perceive, at half a cable’s length, this mass of rocks, towards which they swam and on which they found footing.

zh: 他们在这堆光秃秃的石头上已经生存了九天了。从花岗石宫的仓库里带出的一些粮食和岩石低洼处流下的一些雨水支撑着这些不幸的移民们。他们最后的希望，也就是他们的船，也被砸成碎片。他们没办法离开礁石，没有火，也没有可以取火的方法。他们好像在劫难逃了。
en: On this barren rock they had now existed for nine days.A few provisions taken from the magazine of Granite House before the catastrophe, a little fresh water from the rain which had fallen in a hollow of the rock, was all that the unfortunate colonists possessed.Their last hope, the vessel, had been shattered to pieces.They had no means of quitting the reef; no fire, nor any means of obtaining it.It seemed that they must inevitably perish.

zh: 虽然他们尽力节省，每天吃的只能勉强存活，但到3月18日，他们就只剩下两天的粮食了。他们所有的科学知识和聪明才智都无法改变目前的状况了。他们的命运掌握在上帝手中。
en: This day, the 18th of March, there remained only provisions for two days, although they limited their consumption to the bare necessaries of life.All their science and intelligence could avail them nothing in their present position.They were in the hand of God.

zh: 赛勒斯·哈丁还是那么冷静，吉迪恩·史佩莱比较紧张，潘克洛夫满腹怨气，在礁石上踱来踱去。赫伯特一步也不离开工程师，好像想得到工程师的帮助，然而工程师也无计可施。纳布和艾尔顿只好听凭命运的安排。
en: Cyrus Harding was calm, Gideon Spilett more nervous, and Pencroft, a prey to sullen anger, walked to and fro on the rock.Herbert did not for a moment quit the engineer’s side, as if demanding from him that assistance he had no power to give.Neb and Ayrton were resigned to their fate.

zh: “哎，真是不幸！真是不幸啊！”潘克洛夫不停地说，“要是有个核桃壳把我们带到达抱岛就好了！但是我们什么也没有，什么也没有！”
en: “Ah, what a misfortune! what a misfortune!” often repeated Pencroft.“If we had but a walnut-shell to take us to Tabor Island!But we have nothing, nothing!”

zh: “尼摩船长死得倒是时候。”纳布说道。
en: “Captain Nemo did right to die,” said Neb.

zh: 在之后的五天里，赛勒斯·哈丁和他不幸的伙伴们十分小心地节约他们的粮食，吃的东西仅仅能使他们不至于饿死。他们的身体极度虚弱。赫伯特和纳布开始出现精神错乱的症状。
en: During the five ensuing days Cyrus Harding and his unfortunate companions husbanded their provisions with the most extreme care, eating only what would prevent them from dying of starvation.Their weakness was extreme.Herbert and Neb began to show symptoms of delirium.

zh: 在这种情况下，他们还能保持一线希望吗？不可能！那他们唯一剩下的机会是什么呢？盼着有船出现在礁石视线范围内吗？但是根据经验，他们很清楚没有船会驶到太平洋的这一部分。他们能指望天意，恰巧这个时候苏格兰游船到达抱岛去找艾尔顿吗？那几乎是不可能的。再说，就算船真的到那儿，由于移民们并没有发出艾尔顿换了地址的通知，因此船长在搜遍整个达抱岛仍没有结果以后，就会回到纬度较低的地区去。
en: Under these circumstances was it possible for them to retain even the shadow of a hope?No!What was their sole remaining chance?That a vessel should appear in sight of the rock?But they knew only too well from experience that no ships ever visited this part of the Pacific.Could they calculate that, by a truly providential coincidence, the Scotch yacht would arrive precisely at this time in search of Ayrton at Tabor Island?It was scarcely probable; and, besides, supposing she should come there, as the colonists had not been able to deposit a notice pointing out Ayrton’s change of abode, the commander of the yacht, after having explored Tabor Island without results, would again set sail and return to lower latitudes.

zh: 不！不可能有获救的机会了，可怕的死亡，他们只能在这堆礁石上等待饥渴，等待死亡。
en: No! no hope of being saved could be retained, and a horrible death, death from hunger and thirst, awaited them upon this rock.

zh: 他们无精打采地躺在礁石上，对周围发生的事全然不知。只有艾尔顿还不时地用尽全身力气抬起头，绝望地看看荒漠一般的大海。
en: Already they were stretched on the rock, inanimate, and no longer conscious of what passed around them.Ayrton alone, by a supreme effort, from time to time raised his head, and cast a despairing glance over the desert ocean.

zh: 3月24日早晨，艾尔顿的胳膊伸向水平线上的一个黑点。他撑起身来，先跪下来，然后站立起来，好像在用手发信号。
en: But on the morning of the 24th of March Ayrton’s arms were extended toward a point in the horizon; he raised himself, at first on his knees, then upright, and his hand seemed to make a signal.

zh: 礁石附近出现了一艘船。它显然不是漫无目的。它开足马力，直对着礁石开过来。不幸的移民们如果有足够的精力观察海平面的话，几个小时前就可以看见它了。
en: A sail was in sight off the rock.She was evidently not without an object.The reef was the mark for which she was making in a direct line, under all steam, and the unfortunate colonists might have made her out some hours before if they had had the strength to watch the horizon.

zh: “‘邓肯’号！”艾尔顿喃喃地说，说完就倒在石头上不省人事了。
en: “The ‘Duncan’!” murmured Ayrton—and fell back without sign of life.

zh: 赛勒斯·哈丁和他的伙伴们由于得到了悉心照料，苏醒过来。他们发现自己在一艘船的船舱里，全然不知自己是怎样死里逃生的。
en: When Cyrus Harding and his companions recovered consciousness, thanks to the attention lavished upon them, they found themselves in the cabin of a steamer, without being able to comprehend how they had escaped death.

zh: 艾尔顿的话解释了一切。
en: A word from Ayrton explained everything.

zh: “‘邓肯’号！”他喃喃地说。
en: “The ‘Duncan’!” he murmured.

zh: “是‘邓肯’号！”赛勒斯·哈丁大喊起来。他把手举向天空说：“啊！全能的上帝啊！您的慈悲拯救了我们！”
en: “The ‘Duncan’!” exclaimed Cyrus Harding.And raising his hand to Heaven, he said, “Oh!Almighty God! mercifully hast Thou preserved us!”

zh: 是的，的确，这是“邓肯”号，格里那凡爵士的游船。现在格兰特船长的儿子罗伯特指挥着“邓肯”号，奉命来到达抱岛接已经赎罪满十二年的艾尔顿回国。
en: It was, in fact, the “Duncan,” Lord Glenarvan’s yacht, now commanded by Robert, son of Captain Grant, who had been despatched to Tabor Island to find Ayrton, and bring him back to his native land alter twelve years of expiation.

zh: 移民们不仅获救了，而且还在回国的路上。
en: The colonists were not only saved, but already on the way to their native country.

zh: “格兰特船长，”赛勒斯·哈丁问道，“您在达抱岛上没有找到艾尔顿，是谁建议您来东北一百英里以外的地方来呢？”
en: “Captain Grant,” asked Cyrus Harding, “who can have suggested to you the idea, after having left Tabor Island, where you did not find Ayrton, of coming a hundred miles farther northeast?”

zh: “哈丁队长，”罗伯特·格兰特回答道，“我不仅是奉命来找艾尔顿，而且还为了找您和您的伙伴们。”
en: “Captain Harding,” replied Robert Grant, “it was in order to find, not only Ayrton, but yourself and your companions.”

zh: “我和我的伙伴们？”
en: “My companions and myself?”

zh: “毫无疑问，你们在林肯岛。”
en: “Doubtless, at Lincoln Island.”

zh: “在林肯岛？”吉迪恩·史佩莱、赫伯特、纳布和潘克洛夫十分诧异大喊起来。
en: “At Lincoln Island!” exclaimed in a breath Gideon Spilett, Herbert, Neb, and Pencroft, in the highest degree astonished.

zh: “您是怎么知道有个林肯岛呢？”赛勒斯·哈丁问道，“航海地图上甚至都没有它的名字。”
en: “How could you be aware of the existence of Lincoln Island?” inquired Cyrus Harding, “it is not even named in the charts.”

zh: “我是看了你们留在达抱岛的信后知道的。”罗伯特·格兰特回答道。
en: “I knew of it from a document left by you on Tabor Island,” answered Robert Grant.

zh: “一封信！”吉迪恩·史佩莱大声问道。
en: “A document!” cried Gideon Spilett.

zh: “没错儿，信就在这儿，”罗伯特·格兰特一边说着，一边拿出一张标着林肯岛经纬度的纸条来，“这上面写着艾尔顿和五个美国移民的所在地。”
en: “Without doubt, and here it is,” answered Robert Grant, producing a paper which indicated the longitude and latitude of Lincoln Island, “the present residence of Ayrton and five American colonists.”

zh: “是尼摩船长！”赛勒斯·哈丁看了那张字条大喊道，发现信的笔迹和畜栏那张纸条的一样。
en: “It is Captain Nemo!” cried Cyrus Harding, after having read the notice, and recognized that the handwriting was similar to that of the paper found at the corral.

zh: “啊！”潘克洛夫说，“那么是尼摩船长驾着我们的‘乘风破浪号’一个人冒险到达抱岛去的！”
en: “Ah!” said Pencroft, “it was then he who took our ‘Bonadventure’ and hazarded himself alone to go to Tabor Island!”

zh: “就是为了去留下这封信。”赫伯特补充道。
en: “In order to leave this notice,” added Herbert.

zh: “我说得没有错，”水手大声说道，“尼摩船长死了以后，还为我们提供了最后一次帮助。”
en: “I was then right in saying,” exclaimed the sailor, “that even after his death the captain would render us a last service.”

zh: “我的朋友们，”赛勒斯·哈丁非常激动地说，“但愿仁慈的上帝怜悯我们的恩人尼摩船长的灵魂。”
en: “My friends,” said Cyrus Harding, in a voice of the profoundest emotion, “may the God of mercy have had pity on the soul of Captain Nemo, our benefactor.”

zh: 赛勒斯·哈丁说到最后的时候，移民们都摘下帽子，小声默念尼摩船长的名字。
en: The colonists uncovered themselves at these last words of Cyrus Harding, and murmured the name of Captain Nemo.

zh: 然后艾尔顿走到工程师身边，简单地说：“这只保险箱放到哪儿呢？”
en: Then Ayrton, approaching the engineer, said simply, “Where should this coffer be deposited?”

zh: 这只保险箱是荒岛下沉的时候，艾尔顿冒着生命危险保存下来的。现在他忠实地把他交给工程师。
en: It was the coffer which Ayrton had saved at the risk of his life, at the very instant that the island had been engulfed, and which he now faithfully handed to the engineer.

zh: “艾尔顿！艾尔顿！”赛勒斯·哈丁被深深地打动了。于是，他对罗伯特·格兰特说，“先生，”他补充说道，“你们抛弃的是一个罪犯，现在他已经经过忏悔，变成了一个诚实的人，我和他握手感到很骄傲。”
en: “Ayrton!Ayrton!” said Cyrus Harding, deeply touched.Then, addressing Robert Grant, “Sir,” he added, “you left behind you a criminal; you find in his place a man who has become honest by penitence, and whose hand I am proud to clasp in mine.”

zh: 罗伯特·格兰特现在知道了尼摩船长的离奇经历和移民们在林肯岛上的情况。然后，他们观测了这片剩下的浅滩，今后它就会标在太平洋的地图上了。观测完后，船长下令起航。
en: Robert Grant was now made acquainted with the strange history of Captain Nemo and the colonists of Lincoln Island.Then, observation being taken of what remained of this shoal, which must henceforward figure on the charts of the Pacific, the order was given to make all sail.

zh: 几个星期后，移民们到达了美国大陆。他们发现经过一场残酷的斗争后，真理和正义获得胜利，他们的国家比以前更和平了。
en: A few weeks afterwards the colonists landed in America, and found their country once more at peace alter the terrible conflict in which right and justice had triumphed.

zh: 至于尼摩船长留下的一箱财宝，林肯岛上的移民们用其中的一大部分在爱荷华州购买了一大片土地。他们留下这些财宝里最好的一颗珍珠，以被“邓肯”号救回祖国的遇难者的名义将其送给了格里那凡夫人。
en: Of the treasures contained in the coffer left by Captain Nemo to the colonists of Lincoln Island, the larger portion was employed in the purchase of a vast territory in the State of Iowa.One pearl alone, the finest, was reserved from the treasure and sent to Lady Glenarvan in the name of the castaways restored to their country by the “Duncan.”

zh: 移民们在这片领地上开始劳动，也就是说，追求富有和幸福，奉献着他们在林肯岛的热情。他们开辟了一块广阔的居住地，并用沉没在太平洋里的荒岛这个名字来命名。这里的一条河就叫做“慈悲河”，一座山叫做“富兰克林山”，一个湖名为“格兰特湖”，森林名为“远西森林”。这里成了陆地上的岛屿。
en: There, upon this domain, the colonists invited to labor, that is to say, to wealth and happiness, all those to whom they had hoped to offer the hospitality of Lincoln Island.There was founded a vast colony to which they gave the name of that island sunk beneath the waters of the Pacific.A river there was called the Mercy, a mountain took the name of Mount Franklin, a small lake was named Lake Grant, and the forests became the forests of the Far West.It might have been an island on terra firma.

zh: 在工程师和他的伙伴们勤劳智慧双手的劳动下，一切都欣欣向荣。过去林肯岛的移民们一个也不缺，他们发誓要永远在一起。纳布和他的主人在一起，艾尔顿随时准备为集体奉献自己，潘克洛夫当农民比以前当水手更像样，赫伯特在赛勒斯·哈丁的教育下完成了学业，吉迪恩·史佩莱创办了《林肯岛先驱报》，它成了世界上消息最灵通的报纸。
en: There, under the intelligent hands of the engineer and his companions, everything prospered.Not one of the former colonists of Lincoln Island was absent, for they had sworn to live always together.Neb was with his master; Ayrton was there ready to sacrifice himself for all; Pencroft was more a farmer than he had ever been a sailor; Herbert, who completed his studies under the superintendence of Cyrus Harding, and Gideon Spilett, who founded the New Lincoln Herald, the best-informed journal in the world.

zh: 赛勒斯·哈丁和他的伙伴们每隔一段时间就会接待来访的客人。其中有格里那凡爵士及其夫人、约翰·芒格拉斯船长及其夫人玛丽·格兰特、罗伯特·格兰特、麦克纳布斯少校以及其他和格兰特船长和尼摩船长有关的人。
en: There Cyrus Harding and his companions received at intervals visits from Lord and Lady Glenarvan, Captain John Mangles and his wife, the sister of Robert Grant, Robert Grant himself, Major McNab, and all those who had taken part in the history both of Captain Grant and Captain Nemo.

zh: 总的说来，所有人都很幸福，他们现在和过去一样紧密地团结在一起。但是他们谁也不会忘记那个岛，他们初到那里时一无所有，无依无靠，四年的生活下来，他们在岛上什么也不缺少了。现在那里只是一堆被太平洋波涛冲击的花岗岩碎石，只是尼摩船长的坟墓。
en: There, to conclude, all were happy, united in the present as they had been in the past; but never could they forget that island upon which they had arrived poor and friendless, that island which, during four years had supplied all their wants, and of which there remained but a fragment of granite washed by the waves of the Pacific, the tomb of him who had borne the name of Captain Nemo.
